* The system also includes reinforcement at corners and around openings, and a water repellent plaster sealer and a waterproof coating can be applied to the plaster.
* The invention provides compliance with the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604.
* The system allows for the construction of decks, and the requirements of NZS 3604 must be followed except to the extent required to account for the junction.
* The invention includes various components such as battens, dwangs, mesh, plaster, and flashings, and the materials and construction methods used are specified in detail.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe adapted to contain valuable papers and articles, with a focus on providing a new and improved readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure.
* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening, and a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls to provide stops for retaining the door, with one groove having a depth substantially greater than the other.
* The door is dimensioned to be received in and completely removed from the open upper end of the chamber, and is secured by a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door, with a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar to prevent lateral movement.
* The safe construction can be formed utilizing various materials and methods, including a cast-in-place concrete construction, and can be modified to eliminate certain components while maintaining structural integrity, with the invention being applicable to a basic steel safe preassembled at the factory.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a fluid measuring technique that more accurately measures the fluid pressure in a geological formation at a desired elevation or depth, without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the pressure measuring apparatus.
* The invention involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter in a borehole at a desired location, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and then displacing the grout to achieve a fluid connection between the formation and the filter, allowing for accurate measurement of the formation pressure at the desired depth.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain.
• The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The elastic members are desirably made of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and the present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber.
• The joint block is made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path, and the use of a high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete joint block is considered to be suitably applicable to the joint block for use in the present invention.
• The present invention provides a method of mounting an elastic member, which comprises joining the elastic members together across the expansion gap, fixing the elastic member on one side to the step on one side, subjecting the fixed elastic member to deformation toward the bridge girder axis, and fixing the elastic member on the other side to the step on the other side.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to track transport systems, specifically floor track systems used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks.
• In meat product processing, conventional air chilling methods have drawbacks such as evaporating meat juices, causing dehydration and shrinkage, and slow heat transfer rates.
• More recent approaches use fluid treatment chambers with chilled brine solutions to quickly transfer heat from the meat, but this method requires a significant volume of water, making it economically advantageous to recover and recirculate the brine solution.
• The invention aims to provide a floor transport system that prevents the wheels or support structure of dolly-like floor trucks from contaminating the treatment fluid in a fluid treatment center.
• The primary objective is to provide a floor transport track system where the wheels of the trucks are segregated from the recirculated treatment solution to prevent contamination.
• The invention includes an enclosed floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, comprising a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one extending upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate overlying the top of the channel.
• The wheel channel is disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs, preventing showered fluid or fluid flowing on the floor from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
• Another embodiment of the invention uses inflatable elastomer seals attached to the upper edges of the sidewalls to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track.
• The enclosed floor track system prevents the brine solution from being contaminated by the hand truck wheels, allowing for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontamination.
• The invention provides a sanitary and efficient way to transport meat products in a fluid treatment chamber, preserving natural resources and achieving an economic advantage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a lock device that prevents a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its weight, and is designed to be easily operated manually.
* The lock device comprises an engaging member (lock plate) and an engaged member (lock pin) that work together to lock the boom in place, with the lock plate being supported by a guide member and a support pin.
* The lock device is designed to be simple and reliable, with features such as a slip-prevention mechanism that prevents the lock plate from slipping off the support pin, and a guide member that keeps the lock plate at a prescribed position.
* The lock device is applicable to various types of work machines, including excavating devices, loaders, and cranes, and can be used to lock a boom, arm, or other component in a stored position.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during the pool cleaning operation.
• The apparatus features a central, suction portion that is readily adjustable relative to the pool bottom, enabling real-time adjustment of suction without the need to adjust the vacuum at the circulation pump.
• The adjustment is accomplished using conveniently located mechanisms on the top of the suction head, which regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central suction portion and the pool bottom.
• The invention also includes a roller height adjustment device that can be provided in kit form for use with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies, allowing for easy retrofitting of existing devices.
• The adjustment device enables precise regulation of the effective suction of the device without having to adjust the suction at the suction source, making it a valuable tool for commercial pool cleaning operators.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing in oil well drilling operations.
* Wear bushings are used to protect against excessive wear on seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements during drilling and other operations.
* The invention provides a sub-unit with a mandrel and a retriever section that can be slidably moved between the end collars of the sub-unit to engage with a wear bushing.
* The retriever section has protruding members that engage with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing, allowing for vertical movement but preventing rotational movement.
* The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole.
* The retriever unit can be mounted onto a mandrel and connected to drill pipe, allowing for vertical play or movement to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
* The apparatus can be easily removed and installed for quickly removing the wear bushing during drilling operations.
* An additional embodiment of the retriever unit has a threaded lower end section that can retrieve a wear bushing with a threaded collar section.
* The invention solves the problem of crimping the walls of the wear bushing or damaging the unit itself due to the weight of the drill string imparted upon a rigidly connected retriever section.
* The apparatus provides a simple and inexpensive solution for retrieving wear bushings in oil well drilling operations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools, specifically those that allow passage of other tools through them, and is designed to dislodge stuck objects (fish) from a downhole location.
* The tool has a central passage that can be closed by landing a plug on a seat, allowing wireline or other tools to pass through before the plug is dropped.
* The dump valve is disposed annularly about the central passage, preventing it from being slammed against a seat during cycling.
* The tool features modular stacked piston units that increase the area of total pistons exposed to applied pressure, delivering more power per stroke.
* The tool can be run in a manner that delivers high amplitude, low frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts of the pistons on the housing.
* The tool can be operated to have jarring blows delivered in every cycle or by avoiding such jarring blows, depending on the amount of surface overpull applied to the string.
* The tool features a cylindrical valve that eliminates significant cyclical impacts on opening and closing, reducing wear and fatigue.
* The modular design allows for selection of the number of pistons to match the power required for the particular work string or surface equipment available.
* The tool can be used in stimulation or fishing operations, providing large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string and relying on a single valve for operation.
* The tool may also feature a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall, specifically a completely precast concrete retaining wall used alongside highways and railways, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases.
* The retaining wall consists of two precast concrete modular parts: a face panel with an integral counterfort and a base, which are connected together using a grout-filled opening and rebar, eliminating the need for temporary shoring.
* The face panel has a counterfort extending perpendicularly from the rear side, providing support and resistance to overturning forces, and may have openings for drainage and weep holes to reduce hydrostatic pressure.
* The base is a rectangular or trapezoidal platform, typically set on grade, and may have a shear key, openings for rebar, and textured or roughened surfaces to increase friction with the subsurface ground.
* The invention also allows for various embodiments, including the use of H-piles for added stability, cast-in-place pile caps, and vehicle impact barriers formed and cast-in-place on top of or behind the wall, or pre-manufactured and pre-cast barriers formed integrally with the face panel.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well to improve production.
* The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: (1) the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and (2) existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements that protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
* The down hole heating system of the present invention includes a heating unit, heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, and stainless steel tubing collar, which work together to focus and contain heat in the production zone to promote flow to and from the production tubing.
* The heating unit is designed to overcome the problem of unit invasion by down hole fluids, which leads to frequent failure of prior art heating units, by using a cement block and steel fitting assembly to shield the electrical connections from the pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore.
* The system also includes a method for use, which involves installing the heating unit and heat-retaining elements to properly focus heat on the producing formation, and can be used with or without down hole pipe.
* The invention provides an improved down hole heating system that is more effective and reliable than existing systems, and can increase oil well flow rates by multiples of those realized through use of presently available down hole heating systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore, and provides a simply and efficiently operable mechanism for effective connection and disconnection of a pull tool to a down hole object or fish.
• The mechanism features a controllable locking mechanism that allows for selective control of the pulling tool mechanism to accomplish desired results, and enables the tool to be latched and unlatched as many times as necessary without requiring removal from the well bore for resetting operations.
• The invention can be used in various forms, including as an external pull tool or overshot, an internal pull tool or spear, and can be adapted for use in different well servicing operations, including wire line service operations.
• The mechanism is designed to provide a reliable and efficient means of installing and removing down hole objects, and can be used in a wide variety of down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.</summary>

<summary>
• The present application claims the benefit of PCT International Patent Application Ser. No. PCT/MX2011/000063 and Mexico patent application Ser. Nos. MX/a/2011/005499 and MX/a/2010/005899.

• The example embodiment relates to stave floors, particularly modular composed stave floors, and aims to address the drawbacks of conventional composed stave floors.

• Conventional composed stave floors have a thin sight substrate (2-3 mm) that can deform or detach when sanded or rushed, affecting the floor's physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.

• The base substrate of conventional composed stave floors is composed of slung wood or triplay, joined to the sight substrate using glue, which can lead to deformations, displacement, and changes in dimensions.

• The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate having a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate having a thickness of at least 12 mm.

• The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means.

• The multidirectional holding means prevent displacement or change of dimensions between the sheets, providing a firm bond and improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.

• The example embodiment also provides improved composed stave floors with a longer useful life and the ability to undergo corrective maintenance.

• The face substrate of the example embodiment is obtained from decorative or functional substrate, wood cut in tangential form, quarter form, or another possible cutting, preserving its natural seams and physical resistance.

• The example embodiment has been tested and shown to provide composed stave floors with increased durability and resistance to deformation and detachment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, prevent defacement of the work surface, and prevent slipping or sliding. 
• The attachment, called a large contact area brace assembly, includes an extension arm with a flange and a U-bolt that secures the arm to the ladder's rung, and a resilient pad assembly that pivots to contact the work surface.
• The brace assembly increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, providing lateral stability and preventing damage to the work surface.
• The invention allows the ladder to straddle corners without losing stability, as the resilient pad assembly can pivot to contact opposite faces of a corner.
• The attachment can be installed on various types of ladders, including those with different widths and materials, and can be adjusted to accommodate different sizes of ladders.
• The invention provides a non-slip gripping portion for the ladder that grips the work surface without damaging it, improving the overall stability and safety of the ladder.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool, where the plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, and the collar portion remains adhered to the fastener as it penetrates the substrate.
* The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy, or the like, and is applied to the nails after preheating them to an elevated temperature, resulting in high levels of adhesion and reduced debris generation.
* The nail strip includes a row of fasteners arranged substantially parallel to each other, with each fastener having a shank, and a collation system formed from the plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
* The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions, with the connecting portion including a bridge and a rib that have a generally cruciform shape.
* The nail strip can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, reducing debris generation, and can include upper and lower collations parallel to and spaced from one another, with the lower collation being narrower than the upper collation.
* The invention also includes various embodiments of the nail collation system, such as tapered connecting portions, embossed patterns, and selectively weakened regions, all designed to minimize or eliminate corrugation and reduce debris generation when the nail is driven into the substrate.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries, including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle comprises a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design, allowing for precise application of sealants around rivets and nuts.
* The nozzle can be connected to a cartridge or injection machine and is designed for both manual and automated sealant application.
* The bell-shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts, providing a connection element for the injection button.
* The injection button has a circular main body, a peripheral groove, and multiple series of radially oriented channels and orifices for precise sealant application.
* The nozzle is preferably made of plastic, such as polypropylene, and can be connected to most cartridges or machines containing sealant.
* The protruding ring on the connecting section acts as a stopper and reinforces the area of greatest pressure, allowing for precision adjustment.
* The sealant is expelled from the bell-shaped section and then moves out through the injection button, which can be fitted or removed at the user's will.
* The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, which is important for the pressurization and lifetime of aircraft, ships, trains, or automobiles.
* The nozzle simplifies the sealing work, reducing the sealant application time, and provides a more economical sealing process while increasing the quality of the resulting sealant application.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to position and motion sensors, particularly those used in mechanical systems with moving parts that require monitoring and control for safe or efficient operation.
• The invention aims to reduce the number of wires required for sensor systems by multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system.
• A position sensor signal conditioner and remotely electrically connected sensor monitoring equipment are used to achieve this goal, with the sensor comprising a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed, thereby reducing energy waste and improving sensor accuracy.
• The sensor uses a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit to constantly compare the sensor output to a desired minimum value and generate a correction signal to deliver a sensor output close to the desired minimum value.
• The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by external means, and upon startup and initial calibration, the sensor draws a minimum of current, making it suitable for use in applications where power consumption is a concern.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in a four-stroke piston internal combustion engine, aiming to reduce gas consumption and improve engine performance.
• The system uses a linearly reciprocating actuation system and a controllable actuating means to control valve position, allowing for substantially infinitely variable displacement and percentage of port opening.
• The system eliminates the need for springs, which are used in traditional cam/spring valve actuation systems, and instead uses a kinematic system that positively controls valve cycling.
• The system consists of a rotary cam, a translating means, and a slotted cam that reciprocates along a line of action, forcing the valve to move up and down.
• The system allows for variable valve displacement, enabling the valve to be closed indefinitely while the engine is running, and can be controlled by an actuator, such as a hydraulic cylinder.
• The system can be computer-controlled, allowing for precise control of valve opening and closing, and can be used in various engine configurations, including multiple valves per cylinder.
• The system offers several advantages over traditional cam/spring systems, including reduced power consumption, increased engine performance, and simplified manufacturing and installation.
• The system can be used in various applications, including automotive engines, and can be adapted to different engine configurations and cylinder arrangements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, providing a light member with a housing and a lighting control region that includes multiple control channels for controlling different colors of light.
* The light member includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and can be positioned anywhere along the region, allowing for adjustable lighting effects.
* The modules can be controlled independently, and the light member can include switches, timers, or remote controls to adjust the lighting effects, including color temperature, intensity, and duration.
* The light member can be used with various types of enclosures and structures, including aquariums and office or kitchen cabinets, and can be mounted using a bracket or other structure.
* The light member can include optical elements, such as lenses or diffusers, to change the angle or distribution of the light emitted from the LEDs, and these elements can be removable or adjustable.
* The invention provides a flexible and customizable lighting system that can be used in a variety of applications, including aquariums and other types of enclosures or structures.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine that operates at high temperatures, particularly in the form of a cooled stator blade or rotor blade for a gas turbine.
* The prior art flow deflection apparatuses have disadvantages such as a transitional region that is difficult to cool, thermal stresses between the separating walls and the hot-gas wall, high blade weight, and complex casting.
* The object of the invention is to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that avoids these disadvantages and is simple to produce, can be flexibly matched to the respective application, and is efficiently cooled.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured there, rather than producing them jointly with the apparatus.
* The use of inserts has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall, reduced blade weight, and a simpler cast core.
* A preferred embodiment of the flow deflection apparatus is in the form of a hollow casting with holders in the form of rails that are integrally formed in the interior of the flow deflection apparatus, into which the separating walls are inserted.
* The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape, and can be secured on one or more sides by soldering or welding.
* The invention can be applied to various types of flow deflection apparatuses, including rotor blades and stator blades, and can be used in gas turbines and other fluid-flow machines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The system allows for manual control of the throttle valve by the accelerator pedal, providing full operation of the vehicle, and can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission to switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on the transmission ratio.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and can effectively burn wet wood of 70% moisture content.
• The burner is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load, comparable to conventional gas and oil burners.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel, fed from below, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile in controlled amounts, drying and gasifying the waste fuel.
• Volatile gases are partially oxidized by additional combustion air introduced tangentially with a vigorous swirl in a primary combustion chamber.
• The total amount of combustion air admitted to the primary chamber is maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions to prevent ash fusion and clinker formation.
• The volatile gases are then discharged into a secondary combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced to complete combustion.
• The secondary combustion air is directed tangentially and can be introduced at various axial locations to regulate the position of the flame within the chamber.
• The burner can be adjusted to operate with a low volume of fuel or a high volume of fuel, and has a quick response time of less than 1 minute to changes in the load.
• The combustion air is passed over the refractory lining, which has a longer life due to the lower temperatures, and the discharge gases from the secondary chamber can go directly to the boiler.
• The burner can be used for various industrial purposes, including boilers, kilns, and dryers, and can be controlled by a pneumatic or electrical control system.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is an evaporative refrigeration system that provides a highly efficient apparatus for cooling air, operating more efficiently by separating its dry and wet sides, keeping evaporating water separate from the useful air, and recirculating the major portion of the working air from the load.
* The system can be further enhanced by incorporating a vapor compression refrigeration unit in a hybrid system, where a minor portion of the cooled air is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator coil, resulting in dehumidification and a greater reduction in the dry bulb temperature of the useful air, with significant reductions in energy required to operate the vapor compression refrigeration unit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to pumps, particularly those for pumping fluids, and provides a fluid pump capable of pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressures.
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series, with each pump head having a housing containing an impeller driven by a drive structure to move fluid through at least two fluid conduits.
* The fluid conduits combine into a single fluid flow before exiting the pump head, and one or more pump heads may comprise a combiner for combining fluid flow from the conduits.
* The drive structure may comprise a single drive shaft or multiple drive shafts connected by connectors, and may be powered by a single power source, such as a motor.
* The pump heads are connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between the pump heads, and may be removably connected or formed in a unitary structure.
* The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, as the initial and final pump heads have different design features to permit fluid flow from one pump head to the other while commonly driving the impellers.
* A pump assembly may be formed by mounting a fluid pump of the present invention on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, to permit operation of the pump at a fluid reservoir.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically to engines having engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, to reduce excess components and improve engine robustness.

• Traditional engine compression release brake systems typically include an engine brake for each engine cylinder, but the present invention provides a system with a reduced number of components.

• The invention includes an engine housing defining a plurality of engine cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for each of a portion of the engine cylinders, which is less than all of the plurality of engine cylinders.

• A method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders includes attaching an engine compression release brake to an engine housing for a portion of the engine cylinders and operating the portion of engine cylinders in a braking mode.

• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve, and the system includes a hydraulic system, an electronic control module, and a high pressure pump.

• The engine brake includes a brake body, an electrical actuator, a spool valve member, and a piston, which work together to control the flow of high pressure fluid and actuate the exhaust valve.

• The operation of the engine brake is controlled by the electronic control module, which determines if engine braking is desirable and how much braking horsepower is required, and activates the engine brake accordingly.

• The engine brake can be modified to have different orientations and configurations, and can be used with engines having any number of cylinders and any number of engine brakes that is less than the total number of cylinders.

• The modularity of the present invention allows customers to choose and pay for the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application, providing flexibility and cost-effectiveness.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand various loads including extreme shocks from "blade-off" events.

• Conventional gearboxes and connections are rigidly constructed to withstand anticipated loads, often requiring additional material or being heavier, which can be a drawback.

• The invention proposes a link assembly with a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the links, allowing for translation and forming a radial interface that dampens translation.

• The link assembly can be part of a gearbox assembly that attaches to an engine, providing a medium to long link to connect the engine to the gearbox.

• The mounting link can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox, and in the event of extreme loads, the pin can shear, allowing for a permitted range of motion.

• The interface between the female and male links can dampen the relative motion within the permitted range of motion, absorbing extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox or transmitting destructive loads.

• The female link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end with a cavity to receive the male link, while the male link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end that can translate relative to the female link.

• The pin can serve as a fusible link, shearing when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied, and can be designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly.

• After the pin shears, the female and male links can translate relative to each other, with the radial interface providing coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation.

• The invention advantageously limits or prevents damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals by transmitting extreme loads, while helping to prevent the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to archery equipment, specifically to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts, providing an improvement over prior art by reducing stress on the shaft and preventing dirt from entering the shaft.
* The invention includes a point cap system that is small, lightweight, and adjustable in weight, allowing for perfect balance, as well as a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft.
* The point cap and balance pin design work together to provide a means of attachment that is suited to the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts, reducing cross fiber stress at the end of the shaft, and allowing for the use of a material with nearly the same strength properties in all directions, such as steel or aluminum.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training, providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash without modifying the weapon.
• The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, producing sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, utilizing a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, and firing counter.
• The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle, with a reusable housing containing the electric control circuitry and the plastic expendable, which contains pyrotechnic charges.
• The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing cost, and contains a series of cups with bridge wire and pyrotechnic charges, which are sealed within the cups by a plastic sealant.
• The simulator produces overpressure levels and duration that simulate small arms fire by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic charge, which burns in a combination mode to produce a quantity of combustion by-products, rupturing the plastic sealant and venting pressure through the exit port.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve volumetric efficiency while reducing noise from the air intake. 
• The device comprises a tank, two pipes of different cross-sectional areas, and a valve disposed in the larger pipe, which is actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator in response to engine operating conditions.
• The provision of the narrow passage in the smaller pipe constitutes a resonator that absorbs the noise, and the operation of the valve is controlled based on engine speed and load to create a new compound volumetric efficiency curve.
• The valve operating conditions can be stored as a map in the control circuit, which produces a control signal for the solenoid valve based on engine speed and throttle position sensors, allowing the valve to be opened or closed to optimize engine performance and reduce noise.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part mounting bracket assembly that allows for simple and effective mounting of equipment, such as speakers or other objects, to a variety of surfaces, including poles, flat surfaces, and other structures, using a minimal amount of inexpensive but robust components.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be easily connected and adjusted by one person, without requiring additional parts or multiple installers, and provides 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment and vertical adjustment from 0 to -70 degrees.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a combustion apparatus, specifically a burner that can be part of a system including a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cooking grills, cooktops, food smoking apparatus, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions, and features a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, air inlets, and a shroud to provide a flow path for tertiary combustion air and to keep the exterior surface cool.
* The burner has legs to hold it above ground level, a pivotally coupled ash pan, and a perforate food grate that can be moved to a deployed position above the flame or to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber.
* The burner also features manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances, such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer, and can be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable continuous operation.
* The modular heat utilizing appliances can be designed to work with the burner, such as a cooker with a wire rack, a smoker with a sealed chamber, a gas-to-gas heat exchanger for space heating, and a pyrolyzer with a condenser and heat exchanger to recover vaporized liquid products of pyrolysis.
</summary>

<summary>
* The rotary internal combustion engine has reached commercial acceptance, but there is still a need to improve fuel economy and durability, particularly in the water cooling system.
* The housing water cooling system in a rotary engine is crucial in lowering the temperature of metal areas exposed to high heat input and minimizing temperature differences throughout the housing.
* The most severe cooling problem is in the area surrounding the spark plugs, where uneven heating can cause housing distortion and prevent proper functioning of gas and oil sealing elements.
* The use of in-line or dual spark plugs for a single rotor housing has become commercially accepted, but this arrangement disrupts the flow of cooling fluid and creates a mechanism for vapor films to collect and prevent heat extraction.
* The invention aims to provide an ignition and cooling system combination that maintains efficient combustion while improving cooling characteristics to reduce the possibility of structural failure of the engine's housing.
* The invention features a housing structure that facilitates circumferential cooling flow in the rotor housing while permitting the intrusion of spark plug bosses, minimizing thermal distortion, particularly in the zone surrounding the spark plug bosses.
* The staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses promotes a controlled flow regime, increasing the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement, and reducing locally high thermal conditions.
* The invention has been tested using a water model passageway simulating the passage plug bosses, and the results show a significant improvement in heat transfer coefficient and a more uniform temperature gradient across the width of the gas side of the wall.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to minimize such flow disturbance.
• The method involves calculating the total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position (valve stem lift) and determining the flow change due to closure of one of the N parallel flow valves during valve tests.
• The flow characteristics for each valve of the system with N valves and for the system with N-1 valves are determined during design, and the flow difference characteristic between the N and N-1 condition is known for any given valve not under test.
• The invention uses a test compensation circuit that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing, and the circuit is reproduced for each valve of several parallel turbine inlet control valves.
• The method and system of the present invention were tested using a mathematically modeled turbine system, and the results showed that the use of the control valve test compensating control reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95%.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with the outlet mixture ranging from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
• The valve system has a valve body with two inlet passages for receiving two fluids at different pressures, an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids, and a valve means for directing the fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% of one fluid and 100% of the other fluid, and is designed to provide a constant pressure cleaning solution to each user with a continuously adjustable cleaning agent to water ratio.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of one of the fluids, and a spool valve with a cylindrical portion and a sealing sleeve to direct the flow of the fluids in varying proportions to the outlet passage.
• The spool valve is rotatable within the valve body, and the rotational movement of the valve results in differing proportional mixtures of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage.
• The valve system allows continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage, and is designed to operate multiple identical valve systems from a common source without adversely affecting the fluid pressure required by each user.
• The invention provides a stand-alone cleaning apparatus that allows multiple users to accomplish specific cleaning tasks without disrupting other members of the team, and provides each user with complete control over the strength of the particular cleaning solution being used.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas, where the gas is compressed to a higher pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to a lower pressure to achieve the desired exit temperature and pressure.
* The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method, which includes at least one compressor, a heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units, with an electronic control that operates the compressor to compress the gas to an excess pressure and then expands the gas to the desired exit pressure.
* The method and arrangement of the invention provide several advantages over conventional re-cooling technology, including reduced investment and operation risk, lower energy consumption, and increased availability and safety of the overall plant.
* The invention can be modified in various ways within the scope of protection defined by the appended patent claims, and is particularly useful for double-strand long-distance pipelines having a diameter of 56 inches and operated at a pressure of 100 bar with the use of 25 MW turbine sets or at 75 bar with the use of 16 MW turbine sets.
</summary>

<summary>
* Electronic components produce heat during operation, and in many cases, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating, leading to the use of electric fans as a low-cost solution for cooling.
* Traditional methods of securing cooling fans to an enclosure using fasteners such as screws, dowel pins, or rivets increase the cost of the product due to labor and handling costs.
* The present invention discloses a system for eliminating fasteners used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, applicable in various industries such as automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier with mounting legs that terminate into resilient leg portions, which are separated by a compression gap.
* The motor carrier is designed to be mounted to a panel with recess portions that correspond to the mounting legs, and spring members that urge the motor carrier away from the panel to prevent disengagement.
* The installation process involves bringing the cooling fan assembly into a load position, then applying a combined compressive and rotating force to move it into a partially installed position, and finally into a fully installed position where the resilient leg portions capture within the residual opening.
* The invention allows for various modifications and additions, such as different types of spring members, and is applicable to various applications where forced air movement is relied upon for adequate cooling of heat-generating systems.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to kinematic mounts used to support precision instruments and optical equipment in spacecraft, which require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials to meet weight efficiency requirements, but often lack inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics.
* The invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features, incorporating passive energy dissipating mechanisms to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, while preserving the fundamental features of strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.
* The invention proposes two embodiments of damper designs, a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper, which use viscoelastic materials to dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat, and can be applied to various kinematic mount configurations, including truss structures and classical arrangements.
* The proposed mounting scheme provides a center-of-gravity mounting system, which can approximately uncouple the six suspension vibration modes of the instrument, reducing dynamic disturbances and rotational disturbances to the instrument's line-of-sight, and offering significant performance improvements over untreated mounts.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large size clutch unit of the oil shear type, particularly for use in an aircraft catapult system, which overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions by providing strong coupling forces between plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy.
* The clutch unit features separate piston and cylinder means for each set of clutch disc segments and clutch plates, which are actuated simultaneously by a main fluid supply, allowing for the transmission of maximum torque, and an auxiliary fluid supply that maintains a constant retracting pressure on the clutch plates and serves as a coolant for the clutch discs.
* The clutch unit also features a segmental disc arrangement that minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs, allows for convenient inspection and replacement of individual disc segments without disassembling the entire unit, and eliminates the need for retraction springs.
* The invention provides a new and improved clutch unit that minimizes residual drag, which is extremely important in clutch units of high capacity, such as the 85,000 horsepower unit described, and also provides highly improved cooling through better oil flow control and improved torque control.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes an internal combustion engine with a combustion cylinder and one or more expansion cylinders, where the expansion cylinders receive hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinder and water to create further drive for a common crankshaft, allowing for the elimination of a radiator and increased thermal-to-mechanical efficiency.
• The engine features a water injection system, gearing to optimize output, and a catalytic material to reduce emissions, and can be configured in various ways, including multiple expansion cylinders and different gear reductions, to achieve high efficiency and low emissions.
• The invention also includes a water recovery system to recycle water and reduce the need for a large water tank, and can be used with various types of fuel and air cylinders, fuels, and cylinder configurations, and can achieve steady-state thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies of 94-96%.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method for fabricating steel plates with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance, particularly for use in the automotive industry. The method involves coating a steel plate with a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and then removing the metal alloy layer in an area at the periphery of the plate.

• The removal of the metal alloy layer is done to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas within the welded joints, which can lead to reduced ductility and corrosion resistance. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer is removed is adjusted to ensure that the metal coating is not introduced into the molten metal during welding and to provide sufficient corrosion resistance.

• The invention also provides a method for fabricating a welded blank by butt-welding at least two plates, with the welded joint being produced on the edge contiguous with the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed. The welded blank is then heated to form a surface alloying treatment and austenizing of the base steel.

• The resulting part has good corrosion resistance and ductility, with a tensile strength above 1450 MPa and a total elongation of at least 4%. The method of the invention is particularly suitable for the fabrication of safety parts, such as anti-intrusion or underbody parts, reinforcing bars, and B-pillars, for the construction of automotive vehicles.

• The invention also provides a use of a plate, blank, or part according to the present invention for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles, with the composition of the steel being adapted to provide the required properties, such as high strength, good ductility, and corrosion resistance.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) remote control system for a mobile structure that recovers naturally occurring energy from severe weather patterns.
* The system optimizes efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as GPS, weather satellites, and the National Weather Service (NWS).
* The system uses a Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software application to communicate with microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
* The GUI allows remote humans to interact and choose mission-critical navigation plans, and to monitor and adjust the mobile structure's performance in real-time.
* The system can be used to control any mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns, including sailing vessels, propelled vessels, and buoys.
* The system uses a variety of sensors and control circuits to monitor and control the mobile structure's position, velocity, and energy extraction systems.
* The system can be used for logistics-only purposes, such as navigating vessels past severe weather patterns, and can also be used for energy extraction purposes.
* The system is designed to be flexible and scalable, and can be used in a variety of different embodiments and configurations without departing from its scope and spirit.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction, and a method for manufacturing such a cage.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, particularly welded, to one another in a production step preceding the formation of axial profiling.
* The invention reduces production costs by minimizing cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably cut out, particularly punched out, from a sheet metal material and formed as 120° ring segments, requiring only three weld points to join together a ring element.
* The ring segments are connected to one another via joint contours that engage positively in one another, forming an undercut geometry that preliminarily couples the ring segments to one another in the circumferential direction.
* The joint contours are configured to produce adequate coupling of the ring segments with as short as possible a weld seam length, and the weld seams taper towards the ring element inner and outer circumferential edges with as obtuse an angle as possible.
* The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, particularly cages for groove and angular ball bearings.
* The rolling body guide cage can be structured such that it is composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry, with the weld points offset with respect to one another in the circumferential direction.
* The method for manufacturing a rolling body guide cage involves composing the ring element from at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction, and then forming the axial profiling in a subsequent step.
* The ring segments can be welded to one another in the region of a joint formed by the flat material ring segments, preferably by laser welding or pressure welding, and can be initially cut to an oversize and then calibrated after welding.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present methods and systems relate to processing and transmitting information to facilitate providing service in a telecommunications network, using global satellite positioning to obtain and update information associated with telecommunications service locations and routing travel between multiple service locations.
* The systems include a technician input device, a technician server, a global positioning satellite system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer records system, which work together to obtain and update latitude and longitude coordinates for customer service locations, and provide driving directions for service technicians traveling between locations.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system aims to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields and to simulate measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
* The system consists of two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit, which can be a digital signal processor or a field-programmable gate array.
* The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to create a virtual sensor signal, which represents the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The virtual sensor signal is then processed by independent control loops operating in parallel, which can be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency.
* The control loops modify the virtual sensor signal to generate control signals for the compensation coils, which can be described by a matrix multiplication.
* The system can be used to compensate inhomogeneous interfering fields by generating gradient fields, and it can also be used to compensate homogeneous interfering fields by generating homogeneous compensation fields.
* When two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects can occur, which can be accounted for by using a feedback or cross-coupling matrix.
* The feedback matrix can be experimentally determined by applying a signal to an output of the first compensation system and measuring the components absorbed by the sensors of the second system.
* The system can be used in various applications, such as in connection with imaging systems using magnetic fields, like scanning electron microscopes (SEM).
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample, derived from a biological source, using CARS microscopy, where a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering is sensed in image-producing fashion, and at least one resonance site is furnished by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
* The method allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, enabling the detection of chemical structures that are normally not detectable by CARS microscopy, and providing a stable and reproducible background signal, which can be correlated with the signal from the resonance sites of interest.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as comparing a "gold standard" segmentation approved by a clinician against segmentations provided by clinicians in training or different software systems.
* The system accepts electronic files containing segmentations, converts them to volume models, and compares the models to identify missing or extra volume elements.
* The system measures and weights the missing and extra volume elements according to their distance from the reference volume elements to produce an output indicating the quality of one segmentation with respect to the other.
* The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
* The system provides a tool for comparing the quality of segmentations from different sources, which is useful for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes.
* The system can display a cross-sectional image through the first and second volume models, separately identifying common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements by different colors.
* The system allows users to define custom metric methods and provides a graphic representation of the metric method to assist in development.
* The system can display a histogram showing cumulative missing volume elements as a function of distance ranges and cumulative extra volume elements as a function of distance ranges.
* The system can be used in various applications, including training clinicians, periodic quality assurance testing, assessing anatomy auto-segmentation routines, and evaluating changes in internal anatomy during radiation therapy.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to data processing systems, specifically to the apparatus for executing floating point operations, and aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
* The effective subtraction operation is complex and time-consuming, involving steps such as aligning fractions, subtracting, normalizing, and rounding, which can take a relatively long time to execute.
* The invention proposes a technique to accelerate the effective subtraction operation by dividing it into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference between the exponent arguments (ABS{DELTA(E)}) being greater than 1 or less than or equal to 1.
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} > 1, the larger operand is identified, and the subtraction operation is performed to ensure a positive resultant quantity, reducing the number of steps required.
* When ABS{DELTA(E)} ≤ 1, the alignment of fractions can be performed "on the fly" before subtraction, and either normalization or rounding is required, but not both, reducing the number of steps from seven to five.
* The invention also proposes using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation, allowing the computation of the final fraction result to begin before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is available.
* The apparatus implementing the invention includes a subtraction unit, detection logic unit, shift and selection logic unit, and selection logic unit, which work together to accelerate the effective subtraction operation and provide the final fraction result.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the collection of blood and medical specimens, aiming to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials, a common problem in hospitals that poses medical risks and liability.

• The invention involves a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients, using machine-readable codes, such as barcodes, to ensure accurate identification and processing of specimens.

• The method includes storing patient information, order information, and specimen-taker information in a computer storage, and then selecting a specimen container with a unique machine-readable code, which is linked to the patient and order information.

• The system uses an electronic reading means, such as a barcode scanner, to read the machine-readable codes and dispatch them to a processor, which stores the codes in a relational manner and generates a signal to acquire a specimen.

• The processor verifies the relationship between the patient's barcode number and the order barcode number, and if they match, stores the specimen container's barcode number in a relational manner with the patient and order information.

• The system also tracks the time it takes to collect the specimen and stores this information in the database, allowing for quality control and security purposes.

• The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the need for vial labels, associated printers, and staff labor, and can be implemented in various settings and for different types of biological specimens.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, specifically designed for golfers, that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide distance and other relevant information in a verbal, electronically spoken form.
• The device can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a golf hat or visor, and uses commercially available GPS data to convert GPS mapped longitude and latitude coordinates to measure distance and other factors.
• The device incorporates voice recognition technology to accept voice commands from the user, which are sensed by a voice sensor, such as a bone conductance vibration sensor or a microphone, and responds with audible output via a loudspeaker or headphone.
• The device can also accept verbal or other data input and memorize and compute this information to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules, and other golf player needs, and can provide pre-recorded golf instructions to assist the golfer.
• The device can be used for various applications beyond golf, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include its use in any portable application, with the option to upload and download data to a separate personal computer via a serial, USB, or wireless connection.
• The device may include Bluetooth technology for data transfers, as an audio server, as an audio client, short-range audio communications, and as a remote GPS, allowing for wireless installation of golf course data or program updates and enabling users to access the device's features remotely.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology, specifically to systems and techniques used for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits (ICs).
* The invention aims to provide a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports errors for different regions in a system, such as memory and logic circuits, which have different sizing, performance, and scaling issues.
* The invention creates customized design rules for different types of memory regions by modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip.
* The customized design rules are based on pushing more liberal parameters onto stricter parameters contained in the standard logic rules, and only in circumstances where it is necessary to do so.
* The invention uses a design rule checker to check a design in GDS form against the customized design rules, depending on the types of regions presented in the IC.
* The result is a design rule check result that includes separate error reports for layout violations detected in different regions of the IC, such as logic, memory, and other specialized areas.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules, and ensures that all types of memory regions fulfill all memory rules of their group, while logic regions fulfill both logic and memory rules.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention uses thin substrate waveguides as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators, providing controlled and uniform illumination.
• The illumination system consists of a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser, and a hologram formed on the surface of the waveguide, which can be displayed or used to illuminate the object of interest.
• The waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator has several advantages over conventional lens illumination systems, including compactness, ruggedness, and high diffraction efficiency, with the ability to achieve efficiencies approaching 0.99.
• However, WGH illuminators also have some penalties, such as alignment sensitivity, nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront, and the production of two diffracted beams, which can be addressed through various compensation methods and design approaches.
• The invention also discusses the use of WGH illuminators for spatial light modulators (SLMs), which can provide new possibilities for modulating polarization and controlling or blocking unmodulated light.
• The experiments conducted using WGH illuminators demonstrated their convenience, flexibility, and ability to provide high-quality reconstructed beams with good polarization and phase characteristics.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to measure resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew.
* The test apparatus includes a test head with exciting means to magnetize the rotor, voltage sensing means to generate a voltage signal, and current sensing means to sense the magnitude of the alternating current, as well as processing means to determine the resistance and reactance of the rotor.
* The test apparatus also includes skew sensing means to sense the effective electrical skew of the rotor and processing means to determine the effective skew, and provides automatic pass/fail determinations and statistical comparison and evaluation of the measurement results.
* The test apparatus is designed to be economical and reliable, and can be used to test rotors before they are assembled with a stator to form a complete machine, allowing for early detection of defects and improved quality control.</summary>

<summary>
* The present disclosure provides a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, while denying access to native resources to a managed application.
* The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request by a manager, and sending the request to a runtime host that accesses the native system resource.
* The manager includes information that identifies managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access, and the runtime host is effectuated by native instructions.
* The method also includes verifying managed metadata associated with an executable, inspecting the metadata at runtime to determine that the executable includes type-safe code, and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container.
* The digitally signed container can be transmitted to a mobile device, where it can be executed by a runtime host that accesses native system resources, while preventing the managed application from accessing native resources directly.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers to protect the electronic components from damage.
* The identification card is made by pre-shrinking a core layer of silica-filled polyolefin, printing alkyd resin spids and antennae on one side, and attaching an integrated circuit chip to the antennae, then bonding the core layer to a bottom sheet with an adhesive layer, and finally laminating the core layer/bottom layer structure between two polymer layers.
* The identification card can be personalized with variable indicia using dye diffusion thermal transfer methods or inkjet printing, and a protective layer can be applied to protect the image-receiving layer and prevent bleeding of dye, with additional security features such as low cohesivity layers, security inks, or optically variable inks.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue, in a memory, intended for use in functional memories.
* In functional memories, updates are carried out by copying the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating and then making the update in the copied data.
* A typical implementation of a FIFO queue in overwrite memory environments uses a double-ended list, but this is ineffective in functional memories as each update would result in copying the entire queue.
* The invention provides a novel way of establishing a queue using a tree-shaped structure with nodes of a given maximum size, reducing the amount of required copying in a functional structure.
* Additions of data units are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge of the data structure, and deletions are directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree.
* The tree-shaped data structure is balanced, with all leaf nodes at the same level, and all internal nodes full except for those on the left or right edge.
* The invention uses a header node with three elements, each containing a pointer to a separate node constituting the end, middle, or beginning of the queue.
* The header node allows for faster and less space-consuming updates, with additions requiring a constant time independent of the length of the queue.
* The invention also includes a bit indicating the direction of the queue, allowing for inversion of the queue in constant time and space, and enabling the use of the queue as a double-ended queue.
* The memory arrangement implementing the invention includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, control logic, a flag register, an input register, and an output register, allowing for efficient maintenance of the queue.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices, specifically embedded EPROM devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, allowing for the integration of EPROM devices with other types of integrated circuits, such as DRAM or high-performance logic circuits, on the same wafer.
* The invention provides two types of EPROM devices: one using DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, enabling the manufacture of EPROM devices using existing DRAM technologies, and another using stress effects on common transistors, known as "stress effect programmable read-only memory" (SEPROM) devices, which can be manufactured by any IC technology and are ideal for embedded applications.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a technique for easily and quickly determining the optimum value of feedback gain used for calculating correction amount in feedback control, particularly in the context of moving an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) along a predetermined course.

• The method of determining feedback gain involves provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating these steps to calculate a feedback gain value that provides a suitable evaluation value.

• The evaluation value is calculated based on the error detected during the execution of feedback control, and it is used to evaluate the character of feedback control.

• In the case of determining the proportional gain, the ratio between the length of a curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis and the length of the time axis is calculated as the evaluation value.

• In the case of determining the integral gain, the evaluation value is calculated by integrating the error, and in the case of determining the differential gain, the evaluation value is calculated by integrating the absolute value of the error.

• The method is applied to the running control of an AGV, and the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains are determined for each section of the running course.

• The invention provides a quick and reliable method for determining feedback gain, and it is applicable to various types of feedback control systems, including those used in AGVs and other vehicles.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a zoom lens with a high relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end, while minimizing the size of the entire lens system and preserving high-grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
• The zoom lens comprises five lens units, including a first lens unit of positive power, a second lens unit of negative power, a third lens unit of negative power, a fourth lens unit of positive power, and a fifth lens unit with an image forming function.
• The lens units are designed to satisfy specific conditions, including the refracting power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.
• The invention achieves a reduction in the size of the zoom lens, with a total length of 9.13φA to 9.19φA, while preserving high-grade optical performance, making it suitable for photographic cameras or video cameras.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector, where a charge pulse is generated and converted into an electric signal.
* The method involves discharging the charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, allowing for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals, particularly at high count rates.
