* The device includes a detector, a first fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second slow amplifier for integrating signals, with the option to separate signals as a function of the rate using a capacitor or inductive element.
* The invention enables the detection of signals or pulses generated by elementary particles without prior restriction, and allows for the detection and evaluation of small-size signals with a good signal/noise ratio.
* The use of a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, is proposed as the detector material, allowing for the detection of individual particles up to high count rates and the precise integration of signals.
* The invention also proposes the use of a converter material for detecting uncharged particles, which generates electric pulses when an uncharged particle passes through the detector material.
* The device can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices, and CT devices.
* The invention provides an appropriate detection of elementary particles without knowing in advance signal rates to be expected, and can be used in scientific examinations, medical technology, and electrical power engineering applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches, which are commonly employed in vehicles to selectively connect a source of rotational power to a driven mechanism.

• The driven disc assembly is disposed within the clutch between the pressure plate and the flywheel, and its thickness must be within closely maintained tolerances to function properly.

• A prior test fixture was used to measure the amount of warpage of a driven disc assembly, but it was slow, inefficient, and required manual operations, and did not provide an external indication of the test results.

• The improved apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor connected to a splined hub, and means for selectively moving the movable ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.

• The apparatus measures the distance separating the two rings when the driven disc assembly is engaged, and then gradually reduces the frictional force exerted on the assembly while exerting a predetermined torque on it.

• The apparatus senses the rotation of the driven disc assembly and measures the distance separating the two rings at that time, and compares the difference between these two distances with a standard value to determine if the assembly is excessively warped.

• The apparatus is controlled by a microprocessor that executes a program to perform the spin checking operation, and generates external indications to the operator of the test results.

• The apparatus automatically determines whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad, and generates external indications to the operator of the condition of the tested assembly, minimizing the chances of operator error.

• The apparatus can store specific measurements for each assembly being tested, which can be used for statistical process control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the field of image processing, specifically face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software for achieving accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solutions.

• Face age-estimation is a challenging task due to large variations in human faces, and accurate age-estimation can benefit various industries, such as businesses, homeland security, and law enforcement.

• The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images, which can represent both the shape structure and texture of a face.

• The CAM algorithm is robust against noise and can distinguish between meaningful signals and noise in a given image.

• The invention also uses a support vector machine (SVM) to classify the subject face as younger or older before performing face age-estimation.

• Two aging functions are constructed, one for youths and one for adults, which can be used to estimate the age of a face based on the feature vector extracted from the image.

• The invention can be implemented using a computing system, which can receive image data, extract feature vectors, and estimate the age of a face using the CAM algorithm and SVM.

• The estimated age can be provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, optionally with a corresponding confidence factor, and can be stored in a face age-estimation system or transmitted to a database or security system.

• The invention can be used in various applications, such as automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, and management of e-documents and electronic customer relationships.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, particularly suited for applications where the two images have different definitions, such as a high-definition image from a night vision sensor and a lower-definition image from an infrared sensor.
• The device comprises a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, where each arrangement has a predetermined number of pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and one or more pixels dedicated to displaying the second image.
• The pixels dedicated to the first image can emit a single color, while the pixels dedicated to the second image can emit a different single color, and the remaining pixels can be configured to display two colors that combine to restore the color associated with the first pixel.
• The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image to prevent the second image from appearing saturated, and the attenuation function can be adjusted based on the intensity of the second image.
• The device can also include means for reinforcing the contrast of the merged image, such as by applying a local correction to the intensity of the first image around areas where the second image is displayed.
• The invention can be applied to various types of display devices, including OLED, LED, and LCD displays, and can be used in various applications, such as night vision, infrared imaging, and medical imaging.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system in a motor vehicle, with an enlarged functionality and simple design, providing a comfortable user experience.
• The transmitter has a housing with a receptacle for a removable payment element, allowing the user to carry out various payment actions, and a closure that protects and seals the receptacle when the payment element is removed.
• The payment element can be brought into data communication with a payment system, has a credit card and/or debit card function, and can execute remote financial transactions, with a microprocessor and storage device for security and data storage.
• The transmitter has a normal state and a secure state, where in the secure state the payment element is removed and the closure protects the receptacle, but communication with the security system is still possible, and the payment element can be reinserted to return to the normal state.
• The invention also includes various embodiments for the closure, such as a dummy plug, a pivoting cap, or a translational closure, and can include additional features such as energy storage devices, communication means, and seals to protect the electronics and contact elements.</summary>

<summary>
• An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, becomes inactive when not in use and enters a "sleep mode" to save energy, which can cause the tribo charge of the toner to decrease, affecting image quality.

• The toner concentration (TC) sensor measures the concentration of the toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner, and a toner dispenser adjusts the supply of toner based on the output of the TC sensor.

• The exemplary embodiments address the issue of decreased tribo charge by determining periods of inactivity and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.

• A method for charging toner includes determining periods of inactivity, measuring the toner charge level when the printing machine is recovered from inactivity, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level.

• An apparatus for charging a developer includes an inactivity determining section and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level.

• The inactivity determining section determines the activity of the machine, monitors the activity and inactivity of the machine, and predicts the next user usage based on a user usage pattern.

• The user usage pattern is determined from a collection of information on usage by the user for a predetermined length of time, and the learning period may be continuous, a fixed initial time, or a moving window examining recent usage.

• The charging section instructs the machine to charge the toner to a predetermined level based on the decay calculated by the calculating section, and the performing section performs a printing operation after the developer is changed by the charging section.

• The disclosed methods can be readily implemented in software or hardware, and variations of the above-disclosed features and functions can be combined into many other different systems or applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals by plural heads with high precision, particularly in a recording/reproducing apparatus using a magnetic tape and having multiple MR heads mounted on a rotary drum.
• The apparatus includes a control signal generator, a decoder circuit, and a current supply circuit that work together to control the operating currents of the MR heads, allowing for independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads.
• The invention also provides a method for switching over among plural heads with high precision, particularly in a rotary magnetic head type apparatus, by giving priority to head switching signal data and MR current control signal data in the transmission of digital data at the time of head switching.</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the accuracy of locating one object when another is adjacent to it.
* Prior art techniques use a passive gradiometer or an active transmitter and receiver to locate buried metallic objects, but these methods can be distorted by the presence of adjacent objects.
* The invention uses a transmitter with two antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields associated with these currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields.
* The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables, and the receiver is moved back and forth over the ground to produce an output signal characteristic with two distinct nulls over the respective cables.
* The invention uses various techniques to make the currents distinguishable, such as different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different repetition rates, and produces a beat frequency signal when both currents are present.
* The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to their depth, and the effect is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between the antennae and the cables.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication, particularly for individuals with physical disabilities or those whose activities make handling a telephone difficult or dangerous.
• The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler, a timer, and a bypass switch, and can be used on or in connection with a private telephone line or switchboard extension with a telephone speaker phone.
• The invention provides a simplified, portable, readily connectable, automatic answering service for automatically interconnecting incoming telephone calls with a speaker phone to permit two-way communication with a minimum amount of circuitry and simple connection.
• Two embodiments of the interfacer are disclosed: an electronic embodiment using an optically coupled circuit and a timer, and an electromechanical embodiment using a neon lamp optically coupled with a photocell and a photocell relay.
• The apparatus allows for various modes of operation, including regular operation, automatic connection of the speaker phone, termination of calls at the end of an adjustable predetermined time, bypassing the timing circuit to permit extended conversation, and manual cancellation of the timed conversation by actuation of a hang-up switch.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks, to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network.
* The invention utilizes remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplies energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals, reducing the number of undersea repeaters required.
* The system consists of an optical fiber cable trunk configured in a ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs and branching units, allowing for convenient add/drop points for telecommunications traffic from the cable trunk.
* The branch fiber optic cable is used to unidirectionally transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than that of signal wavelength, which is used as a power source for an optical amplifier located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit.
* The system allows for signal amplification without the use of conventional optical repeaters, and the combination of hub assemblies and cable stations provides strong survivability features in the event of a cable cut.
* The invention also allows for reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units and can be used as a means of reducing the capital costs as well as the operating and maintenance costs of communications networks.
* The system can be applied to other methods of signal multiplexing and can also be used as a terrestrial communications system instead of in an undersea application, with the possibility of numerous modifications and alternative embodiments.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that has no visible fasteners when installed, providing a finished look without exposed screws. The device consists of two parts: an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it, and a cover plate member that has no fastener holes and only has apertures to receive the wiring device projections.
* The cover plate member is designed to latch onto the attachment member using saw-tooth shaped racks and latching pawls, allowing for easy installation and removal, and accommodating variations in the flatness or evenness of the wall. The device can be used with multiple wiring devices and ganged boxes, and is suitable for residential, commercial, or public buildings.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can be fixed in front of a displaying screen and slide over one another between a pushed-in and a pushed-out position, allowing the device to be folded around the screen and take up minimal space.
* The strips have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, enabling the light-shielding device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen, making it possible to view the displaying screen from different angles without hindrance, and can be easily fitted to a monitor using an adapter member or Velcro.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to automated speech technologies, specifically to automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can comprehend.
* The invention aims to solve the problem of native speakers speaking too rapidly for non-native listeners to understand, and the embarrassment or reluctance of non-native listeners to ask speakers to slow down.
* The invention uses a device that can monitor the rate of speech and compare it to a speaking rate threshold, which is based on the listener's language proficiency, and notify the speaker to slow down if the speaking rate exceeds the threshold.
* The device can be a wearable device, such as a smart phone, or a portable device worn by the listener, and can use various indicators such as vibration, tone, or displayed message to notify the speaker to slow down.
* The invention can also detect the language being spoken, determine the listener's language proficiency, and adjust the speaking rate threshold accordingly, and can also suggest an alternative language that both the speaker and listener are proficient in to improve comprehension.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which allows for a higher picture sequence frequency and a selectable resolution in time, using simple means and a flexible way.
* The device comprises a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator synchronized with the output pulses of the counter, and a beam suppression circuit, which are controlled via a delay device to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane.
* The device can be adjusted to determine the optimal time resolution with the best possible spatial resolution, by a simple adjustment of the counting capacity of the counter, and can be used to record IR, UV or X-ray pictures.
* The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for purposes of analysis, and the jumped-over lines can be completed either by a repetition of the information in the preceding lines or by an interpolation between successive lines, allowing for the analysis of rapid processes that previously required expensive film cameras with rotating mirrors.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications, specifically handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services, by integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call.
• A blended call is a call that blends voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session, managed by a multimedia server with blender software that initiates parallel voice and multimedia components.
• The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities.
• The blender software separates incoming and outgoing calls into voice and multimedia components, controlling the signaling paths and allowing the bearer paths to be routed through the communication network as needed.
• The invention uses Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) and can be integrated with an Intelligent Network (IN) for basic call disposition handling and mid-call activation of multimedia features.
• The blender software can be implemented in software or hardware, and the invention can be used on various network systems using different protocols, with an exhaustive list of suitable networks and protocols beyond the scope of the present discussion.
• The invention provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions, allowing for backwards compatibility and the use of existing network devices and customer premises equipment.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework that enables connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies, using dynamic attributes and file bundles, and provides a central reference point for synchronization.
• The framework allows for flexible content synchronization based on device context, employs file compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize communication bandwidth usage, and supports multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers.
• The synchronization process involves a client device sending a synchronization request with dynamic attributes to a central reference point, which responds with a synchronization response comprising bundles of files, and the client device downloading the files in the bundles based on priority order and verifying the integrity of the files.
• The framework provides for creation of a delta list of files to be updated, rejection of incomplete bundles, and caching of responses to increase scalability, and supports both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices or appliances.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner, allowing for timely and anonymous communication.
* The system uses a unique ID and a virtual locale, such as a website or text messaging number, to enable communication between the finder and owner.
* An owner can register their contact information and associate it with the unique ID, which is linked to a virtual locale, allowing a finder to initiate communication without knowing the owner's identity.
* The system allows for various forms of communication, including email, instant messaging, and text messaging, and can forward messages to the owner's preferred contact method.
* The system also includes features for managing open cases, editing account settings, and searching for ID numbers, and can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.
* The invention provides a secure and efficient way for finders and owners to communicate, while protecting the owner's identity and contact information, and can be used for a wide range of lost objects, from personal items to valuable possessions.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to electron multipliers, specifically a foil electron multiplier used in photomultipliers and particle detectors, which offers improved gain efficiency and position-sensitive information.

• The foil electron multiplier consists of a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure, with each foil acting as a multiplication stage, and a voltage applied to each foil to accelerate electrons.

• The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing the electron transmission, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield.

• The foil electron multiplier has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers, including higher gain per multiplication stage, simplicity of fabrication, lower cost, ability to cover larger areas, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.

• The foil electron multiplier can be used in various applications, including photomultiplier tubes, particle detectors, electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.

• The foil dimensions and thickness can vary, but a preferred embodiment uses a round 1 cm diameter foil with an areal thickness of 0.2-1 μg/cm^2.

• The foil material can be carbon, silver, gold, chromium, or hydrocarbons, with carbon being the preferred material due to its thinness and uniformity.

• The distance between foil stages is minimized to save volume, but must be large enough to withstand the applied voltage, with a typical design being 1 mm per kV.

• The foil electron multiplier was demonstrated using nominal 0.6 μg/cm^2 areal thickness carbon foils, with a maximum gain occurring at an applied voltage of approximately 650 V per stage.

• The results show that the foil electron multiplier performs as described and has a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers, with a gain per stage of 1.88 compared to 1.37 for a microchannel plate detector.
</summary>

<summary>
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention allows almost any motion picture to be viewed effortlessly by the viewer with the visual effect of 3-dimensions, using the Pulfrich effect.
• The Pulfrich effect is a phenomenon where images that travel through a dark lens take longer to register with the brain than it does for an image that passes through a clear lens.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a computer algorithm to calculate in real-time the synchronization and control events to control the state of the lenses, without requiring any alteration to the motion picture or control information in the motion picture.
• The invention uses a digital photo sensor to capture the viewed motion picture as successive images, a computer processor to process the successive images and identify synchronization events, and means to provide individual control for the darkening of the right and left hand lenses.
• The lenses of the viewing goggles can take three different states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear, and can be controlled to change their transparency when an electronic current is passed through them.
• The invention uses liquid crystals for the lenses, which change transparency when an electronic current is passed through them, and can be controlled to achieve different levels of darkness to maximize the degree of 3-dimensional effect.
• The lens control algorithm uses an intensity edge finding algorithm to detect similar foreground objects in the successive frames of the motion picture and identify synchronization events.
• The algorithm can detect the direction of lateral motion and set the left and right lenses of the 3-D Phenomenoscope accordingly, and can be used to estimate parallax, the speed of lateral motion, and other information to determine the synchronization of the right and left lens darkening to the motion picture content.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes problems of providing 3-dimensional illusions in motion pictures, such as the need for special equipment, and allows older or motion pictures produced before the invention to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer without the use of a wafer saw, addressing issues with traditional dicing methods such as slow processing time, maintenance, and chipping of thin wafers.
* The method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer, applying a mechanical pressure to the wafer, and causing a "clean break" of the wafer along the scribe lines, thereby singulating individual die on the wafer.
* The apparatus comprises a pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer, with optional features including a ring to hold the wafer in place and adhesive tape on the back surface of the wafer.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device having a protection structure that prevents burn-out damage to field emission elements caused by electrical current surges induced by ionized gases in the device.
* The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that is provided on the cathode and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source to alter the discharge path of the ionized gases away from the cathode.
* The reduction plate or electrode is preferably made of an electrically-conductive metal and is separated from the cathode by an insulation layer.
* In one embodiment, multiple reduction plates or electrodes are arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration among the field emission elements to provide protection against ion-induced surges in electrical current.
* The protection structure can also include multiple, elongated reduction plates or electrodes that run parallel and adjacent to rows of field emission elements to provide protection against ion-induced surges in electrical current.
* The field emission display device with the protection structure can be fabricated using various techniques, including photolithography and etching, and can be used to prolong the lifetime of the device by preventing burn-out damage to the field emission elements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes, allowing it to image in a plurality of planes simultaneously.
* The image sensor overcomes the problems of prior art by providing a means to record information through an edge surface of the sensor.
* The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate of a first conductivity type, with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges, one of which is receptive to light.
* An image sensor element is formed in the substrate, adjacent to the edge, and includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region.
* The image sensor element is designed to guide charge carriers in the image sensing region toward the charge collection and transfer means.
* In one embodiment, the image sensor includes an elongated substrate of a P-type material, with imaging planes on the top surface and two edge surfaces.
* The substrate comprises a highly doped bottom layer and an upper layer that is more lightly doped, with three columns of image sensor elements formed in the substrate.
* The image sensor can be used in various applications, including simultaneous imaging of multiple planes, color applications, and surface imaging of passageways.
* The invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with those used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easily incorporable into various types of known image sensors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to home networks employing devices with power management systems, aiming to minimize total power consumption while ensuring optimal network administration.
* A typical network appliance consumes several hundred watts of power per hour, even when not performing its nominal functions, making power management desirable for home networks.
* The Energy Star guidelines require many home network devices to reduce power consumption to 1 watt or less when not performing their nominal functions.
* The invention proposes a method for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device, allowing the master device to enter a power management state.
* The network master node sends data enabling network administrative functions to a network slave node, which then becomes the new network master node, minimizing total power consumption while ensuring network administration.
* The selection of the new network master node can be based on predetermined criteria, such as visibility, intelligence, or functional capabilities, or user selection.
* The invention ensures that the home network is not lost when the network master node enters power save mode, and a suitable network slave node can self-promote itself to the network master node role if necessary.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation, specifically designed to overcome the ambiguity in angle measurements at low elevation angles due to interference from ground reflections. 
• The antenna array consists of at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet having a unique spacing and height to optimize angle measurements over selected sectors at low elevation angles.
• The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, and the signal processing circuits provide unambiguous angle measurements by combining vectorially the information signals from the outermost antennae of each triplet and deriving a quotient signal that is a function of the elevation angle but not of the ground reflection coefficient.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamp assembly with a liquid-tight seal, addressing the problems of conventional subminiature lamps such as adhesive breakdown, thermal cycling, and moisture migration, which lead to early failures.
* The invention utilizes a polymeric seal support, preferably a fluoroelastomer, which directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack, thereby extending the bulb life and providing further protection from burns for users.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) communications systems, specifically to precoder configuration in MIMO systems, and provides a technique to realize a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems with reduced computational cost and no capacity loss.
• The GDFE Precoder is a known technique that achieves high system capacity, but its computational cost is often prohibitive for practical systems, and the present invention provides an alternative method to compute the GDFE Precoder matrices without requiring knowledge of the covariance matrix (Szz) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise".
• The invention provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder and does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (Sxx) for the downlink channel is rank deficient.
• The method computes the feedforward filter F, transmit filter matrix B, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G using alternative formulas, and provides examples of numerical computations for different scenarios, including cases where Szz is known or unknown, and where the channel matrix H is square or rectangular.
• The invention is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including planned future "4G" cellular networks, and provides a significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The method is described in detail, including the system model, transmitter processing, receiver processing, and computation of GDFE Precoder matrices, and provides examples of numerical computations for different scenarios.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, specifically an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements.
• The conventional fan has a rectangular fan housing with a central, cylindrical air passage, which restricts the air passage at the lateral side and the optimized design of the blade shape.
• The invention aims to provide a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, where the sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying the assembling conditions.
• The fan may be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions with the system and the heat dissipation elements.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller, where the housing includes a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening.
• The sidewall of the passage at least one of the opening sides extends radially outwards to enlarge an intake/discharge area for the air streams.
• The dimension of a blade of the impeller increases along with the radially outwardly extending direction of the sidewall of the passage.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, at least one electrical element mounted within the casing, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the at least one electrical element.
• The heat-dissipating device of the invention may also be used with a heat sink, which may be mounted to the heat-dissipating device by screws.
• The design of the inclined portion of the sidewall of the passage of the heat-dissipating device may further be utilized to guide air streams toward the central portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors according to the situation, without using an intermediate electrode. The panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer.
* The display panel can change the display color by changing the driving voltage, and can display images in green at low luminance and in a lemon color or yellow at high luminance, making it suitable for use as an instrument panel for an automobile that can display images in different colors in day and night time.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means, allowing for wireless near field communication with a connecting unit that establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
• The system for Internet telephony includes a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server connected to the Internet and/or a network, which handles and controls the connection between a large number of users, provides additional services and functions, and enables functionalities such as chat-lines, chat-rooms, and telephone meetings.</summary>

<summary>
* The integration of non-SiO2 based oxides directly or indirectly on Si is difficult due to the strong reactivity of Si with oxygen, resulting in the formation of a low dielectric constant layer.
* High-dielectric constant oxide materials, such as ferroelectric oxides, have several advantages, including size reduction of capacitors and electrooptic applications.
* Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient due to their relative low annealing temperatures, but Pb and Bi are very reactive and can diffuse into metals.
* A Ge buffer layer on Si can prevent or minimize the formation of the low dielectric constant layer and provide a good buffer layer compatible with Si and many oxides.
* The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of the ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is easier than Si, making it possible to form three-dimensional epitaxial structures.
* A Ge buffer layer can be epitaxially grown on the Si substrate, allowing the high dielectric constant oxide to be epitaxially grown on the Ge and aligned to the Si substrate.
* Not all oxides are stable next to Ge, and a thin layer of SrTiO3 or other stable ferroelectric can be used as a buffer layer between the Pb-containing ferroelectric and the Ge-coated Si substrate.
* The integration of oxides on GaAs is even harder than Si due to the instability of GaAs in O2 at normal growth temperatures, but an epitaxial Ge and non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric material buffer layer can solve this problem.
* A method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer.
* The use of a Ge buffer layer and a non-Pb/Bi high-dielectric oxide containing buffer layer can provide a structure with good dielectric constants and prevent the diffusion of Pb and Bi into the semiconductor substrate.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that aims to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions, while maintaining adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit uses multiple amplification control loops, including a third control loop with a lower response threshold and frequency band width than the first and second control circuits.
* The invention provides several embodiments of the input circuit, including the use of PIN diodes for controllable signal attenuation, tunable selective networks, and iteration-free alignment of tunable tuning circuits. The circuit also includes features such as buffer amplifiers to reduce signal distortions and capacitors to level the control signal and prevent overloading due to peak amplitudes.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to network-implemented shared workspace environments, specifically an apparatus and method for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals.
• Current collaborative work-share environments, such as video conferencing and document sharing, are often difficult to use and require complex setup processes.
• The invention provides a system for initiating a collaborative work-share environment between two or more parties to a telephone call, without complex setup processes.
• Each party to a telephone call is provided with a collaboration button and an indicator on their telephone set, which signals the user that the party has the capability of collaborating with the user.
• When the collaboration button is activated, the system causes network-enabled applications to run on the individual users' desktop computers, allowing the parties to share information and conduct a video conference while maintaining their initial voice connection.
• The system includes a collaboration control program that runs on each PC associated with a telephone, which communicates with the phone to control the collaborate indicator and sense actuation of the collaborate button.
• The invention can be implemented in various architectures, including peer-to-peer and client-server, and can be applied to multiparty collaboration with minor modifications.
• The invention can be implemented by remote computers connected over a network, and can be embodied in a computer program operating on a computer, with the computer program being carried by a storage medium or signal.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method and device for inserting an advertising clip into a video sequence, taking into account the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clip to optimize the visual impact of the advertising clip on the spectator.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clips, determining a degree of similarity between the salience maps, selecting the advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity, and inserting the selected clip into the video sequence at a predetermined point, such as a shot change.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections with resulting lower electrical breakdown in very small dimension semiconductor devices.
• The problem of high electrical fields is encountered in the miniaturizing of semiconductor devices, particularly when the spacing and dimensions approach the below 150 nanometer range, producing high electrical fields that result in enhanced leakage and breakdown.
• The invention provides a metal plus low dielectric constant (low-k) interconnect structure for a semiconductor device, where a differentiating or mask member is applied for the protection of the dielectric in subsequent processing operations, at a position below a surface to be planarized.
• The mask position is in the range of about 0.5 to 20 nanometers, with 5 nanometers being preferred, below the surface to be planarized, at a location where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed and have complete integrity.
• The invention achieves several beneficial features, including minimizing damage from planarization operations to the conductive liner, reducing the high field at points of intersection, and providing a lower and predictable overall capacitance, resulting in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring.
• The structure of the invention is made using a standard substrate, a bulk layer of intralevel dielectric material, and a conductive diffusion barrier liner, and is processed using chemical-mechanical polishing, etching, and plasma or reactive ion etch tools to establish the desired dimension and minimize capacitance.</summary>

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer invention is a novel design implementation for an analog to digital converter that can sample and downconvert to baseband a modulated (IF) carrier, achieving three processes: conversion of the modulated IF signal to digital representation, downconversion of the modulated IF signal to digital representation of the baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components, and automatic control of the processed modulated IF signal amplitude to extend the dynamic range of the digitization process and minimize quantization noise.
* The invention utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple down converting A/D converter, placing the sampler inside the predictive loop, allowing the predictive loop filter to be implemented using DSP techniques, thus eliminating the complexities introduced by use of discrete time analog circuitry.
* The Downconverting Digitizer has several advantages, including the ability to dynamically adjust the frequency response of the predictive digital filter, allowing it to respond to changes in the input signal, and the use of a digital predictive filter and a multi-bit DAC, which offers several advantages compared with other oversampling implementations, including reduced die size and implementation cost.
* The invention was implemented and verified as part of a wireless telephone receiver, achieving a dynamic range of more than 52 dB without the effect of the AGC loop, and extending this dynamic range to more than 124 dB with the designed AGC loop, equivalent to the dynamic range performance provided by a dual 8-bit baseband analog-to-digital converter while simultaneously performing the downconversion from IF to baseband with reduced noise performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to active solid state devices, specifically to apparatus and method for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms or gas molecules.
* The invention uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as a sensor or for multiplex detection of analytes.
* The semiconducting nanotraces are fabricated using a series of dry etch processes and have a width of 10-100 nm and a depth defined by the thickness of the originally deposited semiconducting active layer.
* The nanotraces are electrically continuous with the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes, and the source-to-drain current can be measured externally through electrodes that make contact with the source and drain electrode bonding pads.
* The invention also includes a method for preparing the imprint pattern for the semiconductor nanotraces using electron beam lithography and a nanoimprint processing tool.
* The semiconductor nanotraces are functionalized with a sensitizing compound, such as nucleic acid sequences, proteins, or small molecules, which are covalently attached to the surface of the nanotraces.
* The invention includes a method for synthesizing anchor probe libraries on the surface of the active semiconductor nanotraces using PhotoGenerated Reagent (PGR) and a microfluidic cover plate.
* The multiplex detection array is packaged onto an electronics board, and the electrode bonding pads are made contiguous with the electronics board using a suitable technique such as wire or bump bonding.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a singulation and plating method for semiconductor packages, where the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe are plated to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
* The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
* The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, such as a metallic material, and can be tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The singulation process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, and the cutting blades can have different shapes and thicknesses to achieve various side surface configurations.
* The semiconductor packages can have straight or beveled side surfaces, and the beveled side surfaces can have different heights depending on the cutting blade used.
* The present invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, and the semiconductor packages produced by this method have improved soldering results when attached to a printed circuit board.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal and a connecting method for selectively connecting to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN), aiming to reduce power consumption and avoid dropped connections.
* The mobile terminal receives service information from the WLAN's access point, which includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of neighboring WWAN base stations, to facilitate a faster connection to the WWAN.
* The mobile terminal uses the received service information to select a serving base station and connect to the WWAN, and if the connection fails, it can scan frequency channels or start an all-channel scanning procedure.
* The invention enables the mobile terminal to switch from WLAN to WWAN in various statuses, including "call set up", "idle", or during a call, and can be applied to different types of WWAN and WLAN networks, such as GSM, WCDMA, WiMax, WiFi, or Bluetooth.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to the production of multilayered electrical components, specifically capacitors, and provides a new process that simplifies the manufacture of these components by eliminating certain steps and reducing labor costs.
• The conventional process for producing multilayer capacitors involves casting a ceramic slip, printing metal pigmented inks, stacking and laminating the printed ceramic sheets, cutting the compacted structure, thermal processing, and metallizing the ends of each capacitor element.
• The new process involves providing a first electrode and a first electrical component, locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component, and repeating this process to form multiple laminate sub-assemblies, which are then stacked to form a resultant assembly.
• The process uses flexible decals with guide posts to ensure precision registration of the sub-assemblies, and the decals are removed by heat application and peeling away from the sub-assemblies.
• The invention provides several advantages, including smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, no shape limitations, enhanced in-process inspection, elimination of cutting stress cracks, and lower labor content per part.
• The process is also adaptable to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors, multilayer substrates, semiconductor packages, and precision resistors, and can be used to fabricate complex configurations, such as coils, transformers, and magnetic amplifiers.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and related methods of using and manufacturing the same.

• The invention provides a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength.

• The unit cells can be of different shapes, such as tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, or three-dimensional Kagome, and can be made of various materials, including metals, metal alloys, inorganic polymers, organic polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composite derivatives.

• The lattice structure can be formed by nesting and mating arrays of unit cells, where nesting occurs when a portion of a ligament of a higher order cell abuts a ligament of a lower order cell along at least a substantial portion of the length of the ligament.

• Mating is accomplished when at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an array or lattice structure abuts with at least a substantial portion of at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an oppositely oriented lattice structure.

• The lattice structures can be used as the cores of sandwich panel structures, and can be designed to outperform competing load supporting structures made with honeycomb or other conventional cores.

• The lattice structures can also be used to construct materials with improved impact or blast load mitigation, and can sustain larger compressive forces along their struts before truss buckling occurs.

• The hollow structure of the lattice allows for the placement of other elements within the core, and enables the creation of armors with high ballistic resistance.

• The lattice structures can be manufactured using various methods, including injection molding, lattice block construction, constructed metal lattice, and metal textile lay-up techniques.

• The invention also provides methods for making the lattice structures, including forming a first lattice structure through the steps of providing a first primary array, providing an ancillary array, and nesting the ancillary array with the first primary array.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, integrating an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a coal-to-liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility, utilizing both dry and wet gasification technologies to optimize economies of scale and energy efficiency.
* The integrated process benefits from shared utilities, reduced costs, and improved plant efficiency, allowing for the capture and sequestration of CO2, and enabling the production of power and hydrocarbons at optimal cost and efficiency, while minimizing environmental impact.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, with a focus on improving the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface to provide a highly reliable surface utilizing-device.

• The invention addresses the problem of oxide superconducting materials, which have a deterioration of characteristics at the surface or portion close to the surface due to the easy removal of oxygen, resulting in a multiporous material with a large total area at the surface.

• The solution involves the provision of a blocking film (passivation film) uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that surface, and controlling the amount of oxygen in the inside surfaces of the superconducting material.

• The blocking film is formed using a photo CVD method, and oxygen is added onto the surface or portion close to the surface using methods such as ion injection or hot oxidation, followed by heat treatment to position the added oxygen in the appropriate atom location.

• The invention enables the creation of a highly reliable surface utilizing-device, such as a Josephson element, with long-term stability and high reliability, and can be used with various types of oxide superconducting materials, including those with monocrystalline or polycrystalline structures.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, particularly for examining the cell structure within the sheet. The apparatus allows for the preparation of precisely measured laboratory foam sheet cross-sectional specimens with parallel cut edges, enabling detailed examination of the foam material's properties.
* The apparatus consists of a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism, which enables the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges. This allows for the examination of the foam material's cell structure, cell size, and other properties, providing valuable insights into the material's performance and characteristics.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to seismometers, specifically those designed for ocean floor operation, and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination and leveling seismic motion detectors.
• Ocean bottom seismometers (OBS) are used in oil and natural gas exploration, but their remote operation poses challenges, including minimal control over placement and unknown surface conditions.
• The present invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination and preserving the orientation of the seismometer for later measurement.
• The invention also ensures good coupling of the seismic motion detector to the seismometer's framework, which is essential for accurate data collection.
• The apparatus consists of a geophone suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a spherical ball, which forms a free-moving pendulum, and a spring-loaded plunger that locks the ball and shaft in place.
• The plunger is restrained by a pin connected to a linearly acting solenoid, which is activated to release the pin and allow the plunger to extend and lock the ball and shaft.
• The invention is mounted on the door of a water-tight instrument housing, which is rigidly attached to the seismometer frame, providing a good path for seismic waves to the detector.
• The angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft, and detector in their locked position and a surface known to be vertical when the seismometer is in its normal, upright position.
• The invention provides a simple and inexpensive solution for leveling seismic motion detectors and preserving the orientation of the seismometer, making it suitable for use in ocean floor seismometers.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a relative humidity sensing element that can be energized by low voltage microscopic currents from solid state electronic instrumentation, is physically sturdy, and requires no special physical protection. It is not affected by fingerprints or reasonably dirty environments and has a response time of about one second.

• The humidity sensing element consists of a first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric, and a second electron conductive electrode pervious to moisture vapor. The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere.

• The preferred method of manufacturing the humidity sensing element includes forming the first electrode from commercially pure aluminum, anodizing the aluminum to form the dielectric coating, vacuum depositing atomic particles of nickel into the interstices of the porosity of the dielectric, and vacuum depositing nickel onto the sealed anodized coating to form the second electrode. The element is suitable for excitation by a ten Hertz sine wave alternating current electrical voltage.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a force transmission structure, for a vehicle window lift system.
* The force transmission structure comprises a drive plate and a shaft, where the drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area, and the shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole.
* The drive plate is preferably made of an engineering plastics material and has a coupling formed at the center of the body, which is deeper than the body in the axial direction.
* The coupling has a Y-shaped mounting hole and buffer holes located between adjacent sections of the mounting hole.
* The drive plate has V-shaped protrusions formed on one side of the body, which engage with a driving member, and a plurality of ribs formed on the opposite side of the body.
* The shaft has a Y-shaped toothed portion that mates with the Y-shaped mounting hole of the drive plate, and a pinion configured to drive a gear of a window lift system.
* The motor assembly includes a gear train connecting the motor to the drive plate, which comprises a worm, a worm gear, and a damper.
* The damper is made of rubber and has first and second slots that engage with the ribs of the worm gear and the protrusions of the drive plate, respectively.
* The invention provides a stable and quiet operation of the window lift system, with a greater torque capacity and reduced vibration and noise.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver, particularly in 3G wireless communication systems, to improve the efficiency of detecting, identifying, and monitoring incoming multipath signals.
• The system uses a free running counter (FRC) that operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz or 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active or idle mode, and maintains the mobile time reference during idle mode to allow for quick transition to active mode and reduce power consumption.
• The invention also provides a wideband spread spectrum multipath signal detector, identification mechanism, and multipath monitoring technique that monitors signal strength from multiple asynchronous transmitters within a network, recovers transmitted code groups and frame timing, and performs matched filtering and non-coherent energy measurement to reduce memory requirements and enhance detection probability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a protective helmet with a hard outer shell and a resilient liner assembly to absorb shock, providing a custom-fitted helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to a wearer's head.
* The liner consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open and unfilled pockets, allowing for deformation in response to compressive contact with adjacent layers.
* The liner is fitted by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the wearer's head, and removing the liner when it has cooled to a rigid state.
* The open and unfilled pockets of the liner provide bulk compliance, allowing the liner to conform to the contours of the wearer's head and minimizing the tendency for the outer helmet to shift in position.
* The liner can be refitted to accommodate a changed head size by repeating the heating and cooling process, and it does not require trimming after fitting or the use of drawstrings during fitting.
* The liner is relatively simple and inexpensive to manufacture, and it can be formed in different sizes to accommodate a range of head sizes.
* The invention provides a helmet liner that is custom-fitted, adjustable, and resistant to shifting, making it suitable for various military, industrial, or other applications.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a multiorifice wafer structure with a plurality of angularly disposed passages, designed for use in automotive fuel injector valves to atomize fuel being injected into an internal combustion engine. The structure is made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members, with each successive layer of rods disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the fused assembly.
• The multiorifice structure has a plurality of passageways angularly disposed with respect to a common axis, with the angular displacement of the passageways increasing as a function of the displacement of the passageway from the center of the structure. The structure is designed to produce a directional component parallel to the angular displacement of the rods with respect to the common axis of the structure.
• The method for making the multiorifice structure involves fusing concentric layers of alternating cylindrical members and angularly disposed rods into an integral assembly, and slicing the assembly in a direction normal to the axis of the cylindrical members to produce a plurality of multiorifice structures. The interstices between the rods and cylinders form a plurality of angularly disposed passageways, which are more effective in atomizing the exiting fluid than the circular orifices of the prior art.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor device having a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure, which improves the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall, forms an LDD structure by a low temperature process, and prevents degradation of the transconductance and increases of the resistances of elements due to hot-carrier injection into the oxide portion on the gate sidewall.
• The method involves forming an insulating film on the gate electrode, forming a conductive layer on the insulating film, anisotropically etching the conductive layer to leave a portion on the gate sidewall, and forming a high density region of the source/drain by ion injection using the gate electrode and the conductive portion as a mask, and can be applied to the fabrication of n-channel and p-channel MOS field effect semiconductor devices.</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to Internet telephony, specifically an improved end-user interface for Internet-protocol (IP) telephone communication, providing a more convenient, economical, and efficient IP telephone system compared to conventional IP telephony systems.

• The invention involves an enhanced radio telephone that can be connected to a PC and used as an improved IP telephone, allowing it to selectively operate as either a conventional radio telephone or an improved IP telephone.

• The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder that is implemented for low power consumption, enabling it to be used with a relatively low-performance PC for effective IP telephony, reducing speech delay, and providing a low-cost IP telephone solution.

• The enhanced radio telephone can be connected to a PC via a cable to a serial or parallel port, or through a wireless infrared (IR) or short-range radio connection, allowing coded and compressed digital speech signals to be passed between the telephone and the PC.

• The invention also includes alternative embodiments where the enhanced radio telephone is used for wireless data communication to carry IP speech, and where the task of communicating with the network is shifted to the enhanced radio telephone, allowing the PC to be streamlined further.

• The invention provides several advantages, including a convenient and comfortable handset, reduced echo problems, and the ability to use a relatively inexpensive, low-performance computer, making it a more convenient, economical, and efficient IP telephone system compared to conventional IP telephones.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to devices that produce electrical power, pressurized water, or other useful work from surface waves on a water body, specifically wave energy converters that use submerged devices to capture energy from overhead waves.
* The invention uses one or more gas-filled containers that expand and contract in response to overhead wave-induced hydrostatic pressure changes, producing useful work.
* The containers are submerged to a depth slightly below anticipated wave and swell troughs and are held at a relatively fixed depth by a flexible anchoring means or a rigid sea bed attached spar or mast.
* The containers have a fixed depth rigid end or surface and a second movable rigid end or surface, separated and connected by a flexible, gas-tight, reinforced elastomer or flexible metal bellows.
* The expansion and contraction of the containers are enhanced by partial evacuation of the container or venting of the container's gas to a floating surface atmospheric vent or to a floating surface expandable bellows or bladder.
* The relative linear motion between the containers' fixed and movable ends is connected to and transferred to a hydraulic or pneumatic pumping means or mechanical or electrical drive means.
* The pressurized fluid flow from the hydraulic or pneumatic pumping can drive a motor or turbine with an electric generator, and mechanical means can direct drive a generator via rack and pinion gearing.
* The invention differs from prior art in its use of a single container, partial evacuation or surface venting, and overhead surface floating buoys to enhance energy capture.
* The invention also uses a force multiplier or leveraged connecting means and/or multi-staged or multiple sequenced drive cylinders to increase stroke while maintaining higher capture efficiency.
* The device can be oriented vertically, horizontally, or in any other orientation, and can be used in various embodiments, including a submerged elevation sectional view, a plan view, and a semi-submerged embodiment.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to the field of scraped surface heat exchangers, specifically the mounting of blades onto the central drive shaft.
* Scraped surface heat exchangers are widely used in industry, particularly in food processing, and consist of a cylindrical outer tube, a central drive shaft, and radially extending paddles or blades.
* The blades are typically hingedly connected to the drive shaft using pins, which can be cumbersome to install, especially in vertically arranged heat exchangers.
* The invention provides a method and apparatus for facilitating the mounting of blades onto the drive shaft using a pin-type connection.
* The blade design includes L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade, which interact with the pins to prevent longitudinal movement in one direction while permitting pivoting movement.
* The locking tracks have entry tracks and intermediate tracks that guide the pins into place, ensuring the blade is installed at the correct angle and preventing it from falling off the pins.
* The design also ensures that the blade is installed with the correct side facing up, and the scraper edge is correctly oriented against the inside of the outer tube.
* The invention provides a significant benefit in that the blades can be positioned at the installation angle, slid onto the pins, and then slid downwardly along the pins without falling off, making installation easier and more efficient.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette-production and/or cigarette-packaging machine.
* The detection process uses at least one optical checking element, such as a camera, to scan an image of a plurality of cigarettes in the cigarette magazine, which is then evaluated by an image-processing device to detect any deviations from a reference image or reference values.
* If a deviation is detected, an error signal is produced, which can trigger the actuation of an ejecting unit to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the ejecting unit.
* The ejecting unit is designed to eject a large enough number of cigarettes to ensure that a transversely located cigarette is ejected in full, and multiple ejecting units can be provided to cover the entire width of the cigarette magazine.
* The ejected cigarettes are collected in a chute and can be fed to a tobacco-recycling circuit, reducing tobacco waste and allowing the recovered tobacco to be reused in cigarette production.
* The invention can also be used to detect defective cigarettes, such as those with missing filters or bent/broken cigarettes, and can be combined with manual or automatic elimination of disruptions to achieve the greatest advantages.</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a device for interconnecting high voltage cables with apparatus and/or other high voltage cables, featuring a cable termination and a rigid insulator, providing a simplified connection system for cables with ratings up to 400 KV and above.
* The invention offers a common cable connection system for all accessories and interconnections, allowing for factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, reduced tools, and simplified field testing, with the added advantage of not including any gas or oil, eliminating the risk of leaks or explosions.
* The invention features various embodiments, including SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, outdoor terminals, straight through joints, transition joints, and joints between apparatus, all utilizing a rigid insulator with a conical interface surface, with the angle between the longitudinal axis and the boundary surface of the insulator being between 15° and 45° for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool in a machine tool, comprising a combination of a tool, its frame, and tool holder, which can be applied in various technologies, including machining by chipping, cutting, punching, molding, and forming work.
* The fixing mechanism features a curved surface, such as a spherical surface, on at least one of the connecting surfaces in the tool frame and tool holder, allowing for a simple and secure fixing mechanism that can transmit machining forces between the tool frame and tool holder.
* The curved surface is designed to fulfill a specific formula, ensuring a precise fit between the tool frame and tool holder, and the mechanism can be released by a propulsive force, making it easy to exchange tools.
* The invention provides several embodiments of the fixing mechanism, including different arrangements of the curved surface and the use of clamps, groove-nose joints, and ball mechanisms to secure the tool frame in place.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to switching circuitry for driving display drivers, particularly for providing high-speed switching with low electromagnetic interference (EMI) output.
• Conventional charge pump circuits and switching regulator circuits have limitations, such as low current driving capability and high EMI generation, respectively.
• The invention provides a modified switching regulator circuit that creates multiple circuit paths carrying electric current in opposite directions to cancel out radiated noise.
• The circuit includes additional terminal lines that act to sink any EMI generated in the outermost paths, further reducing EMI effects.
• The invention allows for the production of relatively large amounts of current, suitable for driving large displays such as the Apple iPhone display, without incurring typical EMI penalties.
• The circuit configuration includes interleaved parallel source and drain paths, which substantially cancel out EMI produced on one path by the EMI produced on adjacent paths.
• The invention provides a highly efficient switching regulator with low EMI emissions, suitable for driving varying sizes of digital displays.</summary>

<summary>
• A vehicle battery rebalancing system is described, which aims to reduce the time spent rebalancing and charging vehicle batteries by determining the target post-charge cell voltage and the required state of charge (SOC) for each cell, and then balancing the cells to achieve the target drive range.
• The system uses algorithms to calculate the required cell voltage, SOC, and charge time for the battery pack, and to determine the resistive circuitry activation time for each cell, and then controls the battery charger and resistive circuitry to balance and charge the cells.
• The algorithms can be implemented in a processing device, such as a battery charger or controller, using software, hardware, or a combination of both, and can be delivered in various forms, including information stored on non-writable storage media, writeable storage media, or embodied in hardware components.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage, eliminating low frequency and high frequency flicker, and reducing eye fatigue and electromagnetic radiation, making it suitable for lamp power supply.
• The converter includes various components such as input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, sampling circuit, output protection circuit, feedback and dimming circuit, and input monitor circuit, which can be modified or replaced with different implementations.
• The invention can be used in various applications such as bus AC to DC converter, PFC converter, lighting, computer power supply, TV power supply, monitor power supply, notebook adapter, LCD TV, AC/DC adapter, battery charger, power tool charger, electronic ballast, video game power supply, router power supply, and ballast, providing a wide range of uses for the converter.</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for controlling daylight and artificial illumination in a space, including a sensor for sensing illumination levels, a plurality of dimmable electric lamps, and a control system that adjusts the lamps to achieve a desired illumination profile and compensate for daylight illumination.
• The system also controls window treatments to maintain the desired illumination profile and minimize sun glare, using a closed-loop control algorithm that adjusts the window treatments based on the readings of photosensors sensing daylight entering the space.
