* Meanwhile, Keith Mars is investigating the death of Dean Cyrus O'Dell, who was found dead in his office with a bullet wound to the head. Keith is skeptical of the official ruling of suicide and is looking into the possibility of murder.
* Veronica also becomes involved in Keith's investigation and discovers that the note left on the computer was a fake, and that the dean's wife, Mindy, is not telling the whole truth about her whereabouts on the night of the murder.
* Mac, Veronica's friend, becomes involved with Bronson Pope, the leader of PHAT, and Veronica uses this as an opportunity to gather more information about the group and the theft of the monkey.
* The episode ends with Veronica reuniting with her ex-boyfriend Logan, and Keith continuing his investigation into the dean's death, which may be linked to the theft of the monkey and the vandalism of the lab.</summary>

<summary>
* J.R. is struggling with his feelings towards his father Adam, who is trying to manipulate him with a $50 million offer, and is seeking advice from Tad on how to deal with the situation.
* Babe is dealing with her own emotional turmoil, having kissed Richie Novak after learning he may be eligible for a bone marrow transplant, and is trying to navigate her feelings towards him and her ex-husband J.R.
* Hannah Nichols has escaped after a confrontation with Zach and Kendall, and is now on the run with a gun, having previously attempted to kill Ryan and Kendall.
* Colby is helping Dre, a musician, hide out from his politician father's associates, and the two are bonding over their shared experiences with overbearing parents.
* Annie is trying to care for Ryan after he was shot, and is dealing with her own emotional vulnerability, while Ryan is trying to stay positive and focused on his recovery.
* Zach is determined to find Hannah and take her down, and has ordered his men to shoot to kill, while Kendall is trying to persuade him to reconsider and find a more peaceful resolution.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene is set on the day of Bianca and Reese's wedding, as well as Greenlee and Ryan's, but things don't go as planned. Greenlee and Ryan decide not to get married due to Ryan's concerns about Zach and Reese's relationship, while Bianca and Reese reveal that they have decided to stay in Pine Valley instead of moving to France.
* Meanwhile, Annie tries to stop Ryan from marrying Greenlee, pulling a gun on him, but is eventually calmed down by Aidan. Kendall, who is upset about Bianca and Reese's decision to stay, gets into a car accident with Zach, and Greenlee, who is speeding away on her motorcycle, flies off a cliff to avoid Kendall's car.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene begins with Dr. Sinclair and Aidan discussing Annie's return, and Dr. Sinclair reveals that Annie is going to pay for killing Richie. Meanwhile, Kendall and Zach are dealing with the aftermath of Greenlee's disappearance, and Kendall is struggling with guilt and anger.
* Ryan is desperate to find Greenlee and is frustrated with the search efforts, which have been scaled back due to the rough waters and an incoming storm. Jesse tries to reassure Ryan that they will find Greenlee, but Ryan is convinced that Zach is responsible for the accident.
* Bianca confronts Kendall about her behavior and reveals that she knows about Zach's kiss with Reese. Kendall is angry and hurt, and the two women argue about the truth and loyalty. Meanwhile, Reese tries to downplay the kiss and tells Zach that it was a mistake.
* As the search for Greenlee continues, Aidan suggests that the motorcycle may have been tampered with, and Jesse reveals that the dive team found a piece of evidence downstream. Meanwhile, David is causing tension at the hospital, and Krystal is trying to mediate between David and J.R.
* The episode ends with Kendall having a vision of Greenlee, who tells her that Zach loves her and that she should hold on to that. Meanwhile, Bianca confronts Reese about her infidelity, and the two women have a dramatic argument.</summary>

<summary>
• Amanda is struggling after being thrown out by the Chandlers and losing her job, but she's determined to take care of herself and her baby, and she refuses to give J.R. custody of the child. Meanwhile, David is celebrating his upcoming wedding to Krystal and trying to manipulate Amanda into revealing the truth about the baby's paternity.
• Tad is dealing with his own family drama, including his daughter Kathy's desire for a dog and his ex-wife Krystal's decision to marry David. He's also trying to help Amanda, who has come to stay with him and Jake, and he's suspicious of David's motives.
• Erica and Adam are at odds over their business dealings, but they eventually come to an agreement to work together to save their company. Meanwhile, J.R. is struggling with his own demons and turns to drinking, and Krystal and David get married in a romantic ceremony, but the happiness is short-lived as Amanda reveals that she's spotting and may be in danger of losing the baby.</summary>

<summary>
* Erica and Chris have a heart-to-heart conversation about their relationship, with Erica confessing that she has been prioritizing Enchantment over their marriage, and Chris revealing that he has been having doubts about their relationship due to Jackson's influence.
* Tad visits Lysistrata, a therapist, and they engage in a flirtatious conversation, with Lysistrata trying to get Tad to open up about his feelings and Tad trying to charm her into going on a date with him.
* Meanwhile, various other characters deal with their own personal struggles, including Adam and Liza's marital issues, Jamie and Laurie's complicated relationship, and Mia's confrontation with Alison about Jake's infidelity.
</summary>

<summary>
* David Hayward is trying to gain custody of his grandson, Little A, who is currently in foster care, and is using his influence to try and get the judge to rule in his favor. Meanwhile, J.R. is in jail and trying to figure out how to get his son back, while also dealing with the fact that his father, Adam, is in the hospital.
* Kendall and Zach's marriage is on the rocks, with Zach having filed for divorce and Kendall having slept with Ryan. Erica is trying to intervene and get the two to work things out, but it seems like it may be too late. Kendall is torn between her love for Zach and her feelings for Ryan, and is struggling to decide what to do.
* Jack is saying goodbye to his daughter Greenlee by scattering her ashes at the beach, a place that held special meaning for the two of them. Opal is also struggling to come to terms with Greenlee's death, and is feeling a sense of unease and disconnection. Meanwhile, Ryan is trying to move on with his life and find a way to heal, but is still clearly grieving the loss of Greenlee.</summary>

<summary>
* Erica confronts Ethan about his lies, specifically about Zach Slater's guilt in Edmund's murder, and warns him that Kendall will eventually see him for what he truly is.
* Greenlee and Kendall argue over Ethan's character, with Greenlee claiming he's a liar and Kendall defending him.
* Jonathan tries to convince Braden to leave town and avoid trouble, but Braden is determined to hurt Ryan and won't back down.
* Ryan confronts his former teacher, Mr. Hewlett, about not reporting the abuse he and his brothers suffered at the hands of their father.
* Jack and Reggie try to get Lily to focus on the case against Zach Slater, but she's distracted and eventually reveals that she saw Braden kill Edmund.
* Zach asks his lawyer, Livia, to help him prove his innocence and get him out of jail.
* Kendall tries to convince Lily that she's wrong about seeing Braden kill Edmund, but Lily insists that she's telling the truth.
* Ethan proposes to Kendall and asks for Erica's blessing, but Erica refuses and vows to stop the wedding.
* Jack warns Greenlee that Braden is on the loose and may be a danger to her and others, and Greenlee tells Kendall that Lily identified Braden as the killer.
* The scene ends with Kendall storming off, determined to help Ethan ruin Erica, and Erica vowing to prove that Ethan is lying about Zach's guilt.
</summary>

<summary>
* Annie Lavery is remembering more things with the help of Tori, but Aidan Devane reveals that Tori doesn't exist and is a product of Annie's imagination.
* Adam Chandler returns to Pine Valley and reunites with Erica Kane, but he's supposed to be in the hospital and is wanted by the police for kidnapping his grandson.
* J.R. Chandler and Tad Martin are searching for Adam, who has gone missing after his car was found wrapped around a tree.
* Ian Slater is undergoing heart surgery, and his parents, Zach and Kendall Slater, are anxiously waiting for news.
* Reese Williams visits the hospital to check on Ian, but Kendall is hostile towards her, accusing her of trying to score points with Bianca Montgomery.
* David Hayward is struggling with his emotions as he prepares to operate on Ian, and Krystal Carey tries to reassure him.
* Colby Chandler is searching for her missing father, Adam, and enlists the help of Pete Cortlandt, who had previously offered to help her bury David Hayward's body.
* Annie has a breakthrough and remembers that Tori was a friend from her childhood who went missing, and she thinks she might have killed her.
* Adam returns to Erica's house, where he's hiding from the police, and they discuss their plans to take down David Hayward and save Adam's company.
</summary>

<summary>
* Erica Kane is involved in a mysterious plan with Carmen, who has been released from prison, and they are using a tape recorder to gather evidence, possibly for a reality TV show. They visit Louisa and her son Armando, who are connected to a bank robbery, and offer them a deal to participate in the show in exchange for protection and anonymity.
* Meanwhile, Greenlee visits Ryan, who is struggling to regain his memories, and they share a emotional moment, but ultimately Greenlee decides to return to Aidan, who had proposed to her earlier. Aidan, however, is dealing with the aftermath of his proposal being rejected and is feeling guilty about his feelings for Kendall.
* Angie and Jesse are enjoying a romantic evening, but it is interrupted by a fire alarm and they are accidentally exposed to the wedding reception next door. Kendall is trying to help Aidan deal with his feelings and is also worried about her mother Erica, who is missing. Zach and Jack are searching for Erica and think they may have found a lead on her location.</summary>

<summary>
• Annie and Ryan discuss their marriage and the possibility of divorce, with Ryan asking Annie to hold off on filing due to his uncertainty about the future.
• Greenlee seeks Zach's help in winning back Aidan's heart, but Zach is skeptical and questions Greenlee's true feelings.
• Jack visits Erica in prison and discusses her case, while also mentioning his efforts to help Carmen, who is also in prison.
• Tad and Krystal celebrate Jenny's birthday, and Jesse shares stories about his past with Jenny, the original Jenny, and her bravery in the face of adversity.
• Annie decides to give Ryan more time and tears up the divorce papers, while Greenlee and Zach come to an understanding, with Zach agreeing to help Greenlee win back Aidan.
• Erica tries to motivate Carmen to keep fighting for her freedom, despite the odds being against her, and promises to use her celebrity influence to help Carmen's case.
• The episode ends with Jesse giving a speech about the power of love and how it never dies, referencing his friend Jenny, who passed away too soon.</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens at Angie and Jesse's wedding, where three stories of love collide, including Greenlee and Aidan's relationship, Tad's search for his daughter, and Jesse and Angie's reunion after 20 years apart.
• However, the celebration turns deadly when Robert Gardner, Tad's uncle, appears and starts shooting, causing chaos and destruction.
• Julia is shot and rushed to the hospital, where she is diagnosed with a severely lacerated liver and internal bleeding, and despite Krystal's pleas, she refuses surgery, knowing it would only be temporary.
• Meanwhile, Greenlee discovers Aidan's infidelity with Kendall and is devastated, leading to a confrontation with Zach, who tries to comfort her.
• Jesse and Angie escape from Robert in a helicopter, but not before Robert falls off the rooftop, and Jesse is tempted to shoot him but decides not to, choosing instead to let him face justice.
• Julia's condition worsens, and she says goodbye to Krystal, asking her to take care of Kathy and to tell her that she loves her, before passing away.
• As the scene ends, Frankie and Jake take Tad to the hospital in a helicopter, while Jesse and Angie share a romantic moment on the rooftop, and Greenlee kisses Zach, indicating a possible new relationship.
• The preview for the next episode shows Greenlee asking Zach to make love to her, Angie trying to bring Julia back, and Jake giving a medical update on Tad's condition, indicating that he will be all right.</summary>

<summary>
• Erica Kane is being held captive by a man who is working for Jane, who is impersonating Erica and trying to take over her life. Erica tries to reason with the man, but he refuses to listen.
• Meanwhile, Kendall is being held by Ricky Torres, who is revealed to be the killer of Zach and Diana Holden. Kendall tries to escape, but Ricky overpowers her and tries to kill her. Griffin Castillo, who has been presumed dead, appears and saves Kendall, and Ricky is arrested.
• Bianca and Marissa are rescued from Ricky's closet, and Bianca is taken to the hospital to recover from her ordeal. Jack tries to comfort Jane, who is struggling with her emotions and memories of her past.
• Tad reveals to Cara that Griffin is alive and has been working to clear his name. Cara is initially angry, but eventually forgives Tad for not telling her the truth. Griffin is arrested by Jesse, but Kendall promises to help him clear his name and get his life back on track.
• The episode ends with Kendall and Griffin sharing a moment, and Kendall vowing to help Griffin get his life back to normal. Erica, still being held captive, declares that she is the real Erica Kane and will not be defeated by Jane's impersonation.</summary>

<summary>
• Tad Martin is recovering in the hospital after being shot, and he's finally reunited with his long-lost daughter Kate, who was revealed to be Julia's daughter Kathy. Adam Chandler, who had been keeping the truth from Tad, is now facing the consequences of his actions and is trying to make amends.
• Ryan Lavery is struggling to regain his memories, particularly those related to his wife Annie, and is torn between his feelings for her and his lingering emotions for Greenlee. Meanwhile, Greenlee is trying to move on from her broken engagement to Aidan and is seeking comfort from Ryan.
• J.R. Chandler is seeking revenge against Richie, who set him up with a hooker, and Babe is trying to intervene to prevent J.R. from doing something reckless. Erica Kane is offering advice to Adam on how to change his behavior and make amends for his past mistakes, and Annie is seeking medical help to conceive a child with Ryan.</summary>

<summary>
• J.R. and Babe discuss the events of the day, including Bess's near-kidnapping and Jamie's arrest, and Babe expresses her feelings of guilt and responsibility for what happened.
• Kendall tries to convince Bobby to seduce Greenlee as part of a plan to break up Greenlee and Ryan, offering him $50,000 to do so.
• David asks Krystal for help in being a good father to Babe, but Krystal is hesitant due to David's past actions and his tendency to manipulate those around him.
• Jamie is arrested and charged with possession of drugs, but claims he was trying to help someone and was set up by the dealer.
• Livia, Reggie's lawyer, argues that the charges against Reggie are unfounded and that Derek is motivated by a personal vendetta against Reggie.
• J.R. reveals to Babe that he knows the drug dealer who slipped her the drug, and that he thinks the dealer was trying to get back at him through Babe.
• Derek apologizes to Danielle for his overprotectiveness and agrees to let her see Reggie on a limited basis, but also grounds her for a week.
• Kendall and Ryan have a confrontation on the roof, with Kendall trying to manipulate Ryan into giving in to his feelings for her, but Ryan warns her to stay away from Greenlee and his loved ones or face the consequences.
</summary>

<summary>
* Annie and Scott discuss their wedding plans, with Annie initially wanting a big production but later deciding on a simpler ceremony in Vegas once her divorce from Adam is finalized. Meanwhile, J.R. tries to sabotage their plans and Scott's business dealings.
* Greenlee helps Ryan's daughter Emma by re-embroidering a special message on a new Cinderella dress after the original one was lost. However, the encounter sparks tension between Greenlee and her husband David, who accuses Ryan of trying to win Greenlee back.
* Marissa struggles with her marriage to J.R. and her failed bar exam, leading to a heart-to-heart with her mother Krystal, who advises her to re-evaluate her marriage and consider leaving J.R. Meanwhile, Caleb Cooney gets into a confrontation with J.R. and later reveals to Krystal that he has sold Cortlandt Electronics, but not to J.R.</summary>

<summary>
* The scenes depict various storylines, including Taylor's visit to the hospital to see Dr. Franklin Hubbard, but instead meets Dr. Jake Martin, who diagnoses her with plantar fasciitis. Meanwhile, J.R. discusses his plan to buy Fusion and have Babe run it with Krystal, who is supportive but also warns J.R. not to turn out like his father, Adam. Adam, on the other hand, is plotting to take down Fusion with Barry's help.
* Other storylines include Annie's argument with Kendall and Greenlee, which leads to her quitting her job at Fusion, and Amanda's decision to wear a pirate costume to meet Jake, despite Babe's disapproval. Additionally, Frankie is dealing with Fletcher, who is threatening Randi and demanding payment, and Frankie's father, the chief of police, is mentioned as someone who can help protect Randi.</summary>

<summary>
* Jamie and Babe have an awkward encounter with Amanda, who is now with Jamie, and Babe leaves after realizing Jamie has moved on.
* Tad tries to get information from Di about Kevin Sturgess, who he believes is involved with some dangerous people and is a threat to Julia Santos.
* Julia is in hiding and is visited by Sam, who is struggling with his family relationships and feels like he doesn't belong with the Martins.
* Ryan is revealed to be alive and is in hiding, with Erin helping him to care for his injured brother Jonathan.
* Greenlee is struggling to come to terms with Ryan's supposed death and is considering having a baby with Kendall as a way to keep his memory alive.
* Kendall is hesitant to get a divorce from Zach, despite Greenlee's insistence that it's necessary for the baby's safety.
* Zach is trying to gather information about Di Kirby and her connections to Kevin Sturgess, and enlists Babe's help in finding her.
* Julia tries to reassure Sam that his parents, Edmund and Maria, loved each other and that their relationship was real, despite its problems.
* Tad and Di have a heart-to-heart and Tad tries to convince Di to trust him and tell him what she knows about Kevin Sturgess, and they eventually share a romantic moment.
</summary>

<summary>
* Colby is struggling to cope with the events of the party where a man died, and Damon tries to comfort her, showing his support and care for her well-being.
* Greenlee visits Ryan in jail, where he is being held for the murder of David Hayward, and she is determined to prove his innocence and get him out of jail.
* Kendall is released from jail after being bailed out by Bianca, and she is worried about Ryan's situation and the consequences of her own actions in helping Greenlee.
* J.R. is dealing with the aftermath of his father's death and is trying to navigate his relationships with his family, particularly his son A.J. and his ex-wife Marissa.
* Greenlee confesses to Kendall and Bianca that she was involved in the plot to frame Erica for embezzlement and that she had asked David to keep Erica out of town, which led to the plane crash.
* Asher is trying to prove himself to J.R. by providing him with information about Caleb's schedule and meetings, and J.R. is impressed by Asher's skills and willingness to help him.
* The autopsy results reveal that David was poisoned, which raises new questions about his death and who might have been responsible.
</summary>

<summary>
* J.R. is trying to find his missing mother, Dixie, and is getting frustrated with the lack of progress, but Babe helps him by appealing to the bank manager, Alfred, who eventually agrees to give them Dixie's account information.
* Meanwhile, Tad and Aidan are investigating Dixie's disappearance and discover that she was seen talking to Garret Williams at the yacht club, which may be connected to Julia's disappearance.
* Greenlee visits Erin, Ryan's sister, and they bond over their shared grief and memories of Ryan, with Greenlee showing Erin some of Ryan's personal belongings and sharing stories about their relationship.
* Adam tries to apologize to Krystal for his past behavior, but she is skeptical and thinks he is just trying to manipulate her, leading to a heated argument.
* Di and Julia are being held captive by Garret, who is trying to get Di to reveal the location of a letter that incriminates him, and Di eventually agrees to cooperate in order to save Julia's life.
* Mimi is resistant to the idea that her husband Garret may be involved in the organization and is trying to protect him, but Tad and Zach are convinced that he is involved and try to persuade her to question him.
* The episode ends with Julia and Di planning to work together to take down Garret, and Mimi's husband Garret arriving to speak to her, while J.R. discovers that his actions have inadvertently given Krystal half of Chandler Enterprises.</summary>

<summary>
* Bianca is trying to uncover the truth about Babe's letter, which J.R. claims says that Bess is Miranda, but Erica is skeptical and warns Bianca not to get her hopes up. Meanwhile, Tad is dealing with the aftermath of Jamie's actions and trying to figure out what to do next, while Joe is advising him to tell the truth to Bianca and J.R.
* Ryan is investigating the shooting and suspects Zach, but Zach denies any involvement. Meanwhile, Greenlee is struggling with her mental health and accuses Kendall of killing Ryan, but Jonathan intervenes and tries to calm her down. Ryan eventually returns and tries to reassure Greenlee that he is alive and well.
* Ethan is in jail but is released after Livia files a motion to dismiss the charges due to new evidence. Maria discovers that Zach was behind the second shooting and that he deliberately didn't bail Ethan out to make it look like he was innocent. The episode ends with a cliffhanger as Greenlee is taken to the hospital and a doctor suggests that she may have a brain tumor.</summary>

<summary>
* The scene opens with various characters preparing for a charity gala, including Frankie, Randi, Angie, Natalia, and Rebecca, all of whom are getting ready to attend the event.
* Meanwhile, Taylor is hesitant to attend the gala with Jake, but eventually agrees, revealing that she is still grieving the loss of her loved one, Brot.
* At the gala, tensions rise as Greenlee clashes with Erica over control of Fusion, while David causes trouble by flirting with Krystal and bidding on a dance with Erica.
* Zach arrives at the gala, but is clearly distracted by his wife Kendall's condition, and later reveals to Reese that the doctor has told him to bring Kendall home to Pine Valley to die.
* Annie, who has been missing, calls Ryan and tells him she wants to meet him at the gala, leading Jesse to increase security and warn Greenlee and Ryan to be careful.
* As the evening wears on, Annie appears at the gala, wielding a bloody knife and declaring that she and Ryan are going to get married, despite Ryan's attempts to calm her down.
* The scene ends with Annie looking down at the bloody knife, and Erica lying motionless on the floor of the ladies' room, suggesting that Annie may have attacked her.
* The gala, which was intended to be a night of charity and celebration, has descended into chaos and violence, with many characters left reeling from the events of the evening.</summary>

<summary>
• Kendall tries to explain to Greenlee why she carried Ryan's child, but Greenlee is too hurt and angry to listen, feeling betrayed by both Kendall and Ryan, and ultimately decides to leave them both behind. Meanwhile, Zach defends Kendall's actions to Jack, saying she did it out of love for Greenlee, and Erica is determined to find out more about Dr. Greg Madden, who she believes is behind the whole situation.
• Ryan tries to stop Greenlee from leaving, but she is resolute in her decision, feeling that she has been broken by the pain and betrayal she has suffered. Kendall and Ryan are left to deal with the aftermath of Greenlee's departure, with Kendall trying to justify her actions to Ryan, who is angry and hurt by her decision to keep the pregnancy a secret.
• Elsewhere, Erin and Aidan have a confrontation in the park, but eventually begin to open up to each other, with Erin explaining her devotion to her brother Jonathan and Aidan sharing his own experiences. Josh confronts his father, Dr. Greg Madden, about his actions, and Erica and Jack try to come to terms with the situation and figure out how to move forward as a family.</summary>

<summary>
• Emily is accused of tormenting Rosanna and setting up Will, but she denies the allegations and offers to take a polygraph test to prove her innocence, while her family and friends are torn between believing her and suspecting that she may be capable of such actions.
• Meanwhile, Lucy and Rafael are rescued by Dusty after being trapped in a mine, but their relief is short-lived as Dominic appears, threatening to harm them, and other storylines unfold, including Aaron and Alison's relationship, Margo and Tom's reconciliation, and Jordan's release from jail after being cleared of charges.</summary>

<summary>
* Gwen and Will introduce their daughter Hallie to Casey, who has just been released from jail, and they all try to reconnect and move forward with their lives.
* Brad is recovering from a broken leg and Katie is taking care of him, but their relationship is complicated and they have different feelings for each other.
* Parker is struggling with his parents' divorce and his own anger issues, and his parents, Jack and Carly, are trying to get him to see a therapist to work through his problems.
* Dr. Seidman, the therapist, suggests that Jack and Carly's own issues and anger towards each other are contributing to Parker's problems, and that they need to work on their relationship in order to help their son.
* Barbara reveals to Lisa that she has cancer, and Lisa encourages her to tell her children and seek support from her family.
* Casey is trying to get a job and start his life over after being released from jail, and his grandmother Lisa offers him a job at her diner.
* Brad tries to confess his feelings to Katie, but she is hesitant and unsure of how to respond.
* Carly and Sam bond over their shared experiences of loss and struggle, and Carly invites Sam to stay with her while he is dealing with his own personal issues.
* The episode ends with several cliffhangers, including Emily being questioned about Dusty's murder, Parker getting in trouble, and Kit returning to town with a mysterious warning for Carly.
</summary>

<summary>
* Casey Hughes is preparing for his wedding to Alison Stewart, but he's feeling nervous and unsure if he's ready for the commitment.
* Meanwhile, Mick Dante has escaped from the hospital and is being pursued by Paul Ryan, who is determined to stop him from hurting anyone else.
* Alison is trying to help Mick, who claims that James Stenbeck's programming is controlling his actions, but she's also torn between her loyalty to her sister and her feelings for Mick.
* Paul is determined to kill Mick, who he believes is James Stenbeck, and is willing to risk going to jail for it.
* Emily tries to stop Paul from leaving the house with a gun, but he's resolute in his decision.
* Barbara reveals to Henry that she believes Mick is James Stenbeck, who has discovered a youth serum that has made him younger.
* Henry is skeptical of Barbara's claims and warns her that Mick is using James to get to her money.
* Alison returns to Casey's house, but is clearly distracted and worried about Mick and the danger he poses.
* Mick is struggling with his own identity, torn between his loyalty to James Stenbeck and his growing feelings for Alison, and is ultimately convinced by James' voice in his head to take revenge on those who wronged him.
</summary>

<summary>
* Casey runs into Maddie, who is carrying a large coat with a surprise for Nate, but it turns out Nate doesn't have a date with Maddie, and Casey teases her about it.
* Mike and Katie share a romantic moment, and Mike gives Katie a PDA as a Valentine's Day gift, so they can stay in touch.
* Jack and Carly have a romantic evening, and Nick covers for Jack at work, allowing him to spend time with his wife.
* Lily discovers she's pregnant, and Holden is initially shocked but ultimately happy about the news.
* Paul is revealed to be alive, and Meg finds him, but he's not doing well and is trying to keep his survival a secret from Jennifer.
* Jennifer is struggling with the idea that Paul might still be alive, and Dusty tries to reassure her that he's there for her.
* Gwen and Will share a romantic moment, and Gwen starts playing her guitar again, singing a song she wrote.
* Maddie helps Gwen and Will by creating a diversion to throw the police off their trail, and they appreciate her help.
* The episode ends with several cliffhangers, including Casey suspecting that Will and Gwen are up to something, Jennifer asking for help finding her brother, and Meg warning Paul that his plan to keep his survival a secret could put him in danger.</summary>

<summary>
* Mick Dante, a man programmed to think like James Stenbeck, holds several people hostage at a church, including Casey, Alison, Emily, Paul, and Barbara, and forces them to play a game of truth or dare, revealing secrets and lies among the group.
* Alison reveals that she slept with Mick a few days ago, which devastates Casey and causes tension among the group, but she later tries to make amends and connect with Mick, who is struggling with his programming and his feelings for her.
* As the standoff continues, Margo, Casey's mother and a police officer, tries to negotiate with Mick and find a way to rescue the hostages, while Tom, Casey's father, tries to provide emotional support to the family and help find a solution.
* The situation escalates as Mick becomes increasingly unstable and violent, but Alison tries to reach out to him and help him overcome his programming, and eventually, she and Mick escape from the church together, pursued by Casey and the police.
* The episode ends with Mick being shot by the police and Alison trying to save him, while the other characters deal with the aftermath of the ordeal and the revelations that came out during the standoff, including Casey's heartbreak over Alison's infidelity and Paul's declaration of love for Emily.</summary>

<summary>
* Brad and Katie are trying to conceive a child through a surrogate, Vienna, with Henry's support, but Henry is struggling with his own feelings of jealousy and insecurity about the situation.
* Meanwhile, Luke is dealing with his own personal struggles and eventually finds his way back to his foundation, with the help of Noah and Brian, and decides to continue his work with the foundation, with his mother Lily as the new administrator.</summary>

<summary>
• Jennifer is struggling to balance her work and personal life, particularly with her relaunch of Street Jeans and her upcoming wedding to Mike, while also dealing with her pregnancy and her mother Barbara's constant involvement.
• Will is trying to clear up a misunderstanding with Alison, who thinks he broke into her apartment and is now trying to take advantage of her, but Will insists he was just trying to help and is being unfairly judged.
• Holden is concerned about Keith's influence on Lily and their children, and enlists Jack's help to investigate Keith's past, but Jack is hesitant to get involved and thinks Holden may be motivated by jealousy.
• Tom and Margo are enjoying a night out at a dance, where they run into Lily and Keith, who are trying to keep a low profile but are eventually confronted by Holden, who accuses Keith of being a deadbeat and owing money to a man with a gun.
• Celia is causing tension between Casey and Will by spreading rumors about Will's intentions towards Alison, which leads to a confrontation between Casey and Celia about her behavior.
• The episode ends with a dramatic cliffhanger, as Keith is confronted by a man named Vin who is demanding money from him, and Lily screams for help as a gunshot is heard.</summary>

<summary>
*Katie and Brad are set to appear on a reality TV show about their journey to get pregnant, but Katie faints on set and is rushed to the hospital, where she is diagnosed with elevated blood pressure and put on bed rest.
*Vienna agrees to fill in for Katie on the TV show, which causes tension with her husband Henry, who is still grieving the loss of their own baby and feels uncomfortable with Vienna's close relationship with Brad.
*Paul, who has kidnapped his daughter Eliza, is on the run with Rosanna, who is helping him care for the baby, and they stop at a diner where Rosanna sings to entertain the patrons and they are given food and shelter for the night.
*Bonnie and Dusty are searching for Paul and Eliza, but Bonnie is feeling unwell and they are forced to stop and rest, during which time Dusty shows a softer side and takes care of Bonnie.
*Brad and Vienna's TV show is a success, and they are offered a trial run as co-hosts, which Brad accepts, but Henry is unhappy about the situation and feels threatened by Brad's charm and charisma.
*Katie is recovering at home and is happy to see Brad and Vienna's success on TV, but Henry's concerns about their relationship continue to grow, and Paul's situation with Eliza remains unresolved as he tries to evade capture and find a safe place to stay.</summary>

<summary>
• Meg is considering giving Paul visitation rights to their daughter Eliza, despite Dusty's disapproval, and has drawn up a revised custody agreement that would allow Paul to increase his time with Eliza if he follows the rules. Damian supports Meg's decision, but Dusty is strongly opposed to it.
• Rosanna is staying with Paul at Fairwinds and is considering finding a new job, but Paul is trying to convince her to help him get revenge on Craig, who took her money. Rosanna is hesitant to get involved, but Paul is determined to help her.
• Carly is struggling with her relationships with her son Parker and her sister Rosanna, and is considering giving Craig another chance despite Rosanna's disapproval. Meanwhile, Paul is snooping around Craig's room and has accessed his laptop, where he has found some incriminating information.</summary>

<summary>
* Barbara reveals that James Steinbeck took Paul to a hunting lodge in the woods, where there was an old well, and she thinks this might be where Lily and Rose are being held.
* Carly is getting ready for her wedding to Jack, but is distracted by a visit from Dr. Banks, who reveals that the biological father of her baby is listed on a form, causing Carly to be uncertain about the timing of the wedding.
* Craig is trying to warn Katie about Mike Kasnoff, but Rosanna tells him to mind his own business and let Katie make her own decisions.
* The search party, including Holden, Dusty, and Margo, are searching for Lily and Rose in the woods, using a map and a device that can pick up the frequency of the walkie-talkie that Lily and Rose have.
* Carly and Jack's wedding ceremony takes place, with Hannah officiating and many friends and family members in attendance, including Molly, Mike, and Parker.
* During the ceremony, Craig gives a blessing, and Rosanna adds her own words of wisdom, wishing the couple joy and happiness, and Molly and Katie also offer their thoughts and well-wishes.
* After the ceremony, Carly reveals to Jack that she has something important to tell him, and it is implied that she may be about to reveal the identity of Sage's biological father, while Holden receives a call from Margo saying that she knows where Lily and Rose are, and Brackett appears to have found Rose in the woods.</summary>

<summary>
*Lily has a nightmare about Ethan being rescued from the hole, but it's revealed to be just a dream.
*Ethan's family is worried about his rescue and is waiting for news.
*Henry is being held captive by Derek, who is working for James Stenbeck.
*Vienna and Bonnie are also being held captive and are trying to survive.
*Paul is revealed to be down in the hole with Ethan and is helping with the rescue.
*The rescue team is working to get Ethan out of the hole, but it's a complicated process.
*Ethan is finally rescued and taken to the hospital, where he is treated for dehydration and shock.
*Meanwhile, Meg is trying to get Paul out of the hole, but the rescue team is having trouble.
*James Stenbeck reveals that he wants Meg's baby as an heir and is willing to let Paul die if she doesn't agree.
*The rescue team's efforts to save Paul ultimately fail, and he is presumed dead after a cave-in.</summary>

<summary>
* Janet is frantically searching for her daughter Liberty, who didn't come home the previous night, and Jack tries to calm her down.
* Liberty is revealed to be at Fairwinds, having breakfast with Paul and Emily, who are trying to convince her to move in with them until she gives birth.
* Janet is opposed to the idea of Liberty moving in with Paul and Emily, and a heated argument ensues when Emily and Liberty arrive at the farm.
* Liberty ultimately decides to leave with Emily, despite Janet's protests.
* Meanwhile, Adam is preparing for his hearing, and Maddie is struggling with her decision to testify on his behalf.
* Casey tries to convince Maddie not to testify, but she ultimately decides to go through with it.
* At the hearing, Maddie testifies that she thought Adam was attacking Gwen, but later realized he wasn't, and that she and Gwen buried him alive by mistake.
* The judge dismisses the case, and Adam is a free man.
* However, Casey reveals that he had a change of heart and told Adam to leave town, and Adam is shown to be packing his bags and leaving a note for his mother.
* The episode ends with Margo and Tom searching for Adam, who has seemingly disappeared, and Alison confronting Casey about his actions.
</summary>

<summary>
* Carly is struggling with her emotions after being diagnosed with a brain tumor, and her son Parker is trying to find a way to save her life by looking into experimental treatments.
* Luke and Noah's relationship is progressing, and Noah's father, Colonel Mayer, is making an effort to accept and understand his son's lifestyle.
* Rosanna is dealing with the aftermath of lying under oath to protect Craig, and she's worried that Paul will find out and leave her.
* Craig is trying to convince Meg to fully commit to their marriage, but she's still having doubts and is being influenced by Paul's warnings about Craig's past behavior.
* Dusty is injured and being helped by Sly, who is trying to get in touch with Lily Snyder to get paid for his services.
* Colonel Mayer is trying to make amends with Luke and his family, and he's invited to join them for dinner.
* Rosanna meets with Craig and demands that he get Meg pregnant in order to keep her away from Paul.
* Carly tells Parker that the experimental treatment in Berlin won't work for her type of tumor, and she wants to focus on making the most of the time they have left together.
* Noah and Luke share a romantic moment, but they're still worried about how Colonel Mayer will react to their relationship.
* The scene ends with Colonel Mayer being confronted by Sly about his involvement in Dusty's injury, and Rosanna discovering a video on her phone that could potentially ruin her relationship with Paul.
</summary>

<summary>
* Chris Hughes returns to Oakdale and meets up with his girlfriend Emily Stewart, and they discuss their plans to find a place to live together.
* Chris's father, Bob Hughes, is disappointed that Chris didn't show up to work on time and is skeptical of his idea to work with biochemist Evan Walsh on a nano-robotics project.
* Carly Tenney is planning her wedding to Jack Snyder, but her brother Brad is opposed to the idea and thinks she's manipulating Jack.
* Jack is going along with the wedding plans, but is also struggling with his feelings for his ex-wife Katie.
* Emma Snyder is helping Carly with the wedding preparations, but is also concerned about the situation and its impact on Jack and Katie.
* Chris's family is surprised to learn that he is living with Emily, and his father is still resistant to his ideas for the hospital.
* The minister who is supposed to perform the wedding ceremony expresses some reservations, but ultimately agrees to do it.
* Carly and Jack reassure the minister that they are committed to each other and to their family, and that they want to spend as much time together as possible.
* Meanwhile, Katie is on her way back to Oakdale and is determined to stop the wedding.
* The episode ends with a cliffhanger, as Katie reveals that she knows Carly has been faking her illness and is determined to expose her.
</summary>

<summary>
• Liam is frustrated and worried as he waits for Steffy, who is late and not answering his calls. He confides in his father, Bill, about his concerns and eventually decides to leave on Bill's jet, feeling he can't wait for Steffy anymore.
• Meanwhile, Steffy is finalizing her divorce from Wyatt by getting her wedding band removed with a laser treatment. Wyatt is also getting his band removed and they share a bittersweet moment, with Wyatt admitting he will always love Steffy.
• Quinn is struggling with her feelings of guilt and anxiety after her encounter with Ridge in San Francisco. She confides in Ridge, who assures her that their secret is safe and that they have a newfound understanding and respect for each other.
• Katie is concerned about Quinn's behavior and talks to Ivy about it, revealing that she spent time with Eric while Quinn was away. Ivy is worried about Quinn's reaction, but Katie is unsure why Quinn is so worked up.
• Steffy finally arrives at Liam's place, apologizing for being late and revealing that her divorce from Wyatt is final. Liam is overjoyed, and the two share a romantic moment, with Steffy declaring that she is all his now.</summary>

<summary>
• Stephanie confronts Rick about his relationship with Steffy, warning him that it will end in disaster and that he's putting Steffy in a difficult position between him and her father, Ridge.
• Rick refuses to end the relationship, despite Stephanie's warnings, and tells her that he's in love with Steffy and wants a future with her.
• Meanwhile, Jackie introduces Bridget, aka "Madame X," as the new designer for her company, and they discuss how to create a persona and backstory for Bridget's new identity.
• Katie confronts Jackie about stealing designs from Forrester Creations, but Jackie denies any wrongdoing and claims that she was sent the designs.
• Nick tries to intervene, but Katie is angry and feels that Jackie is trying to sabotage Forrester Creations.
• Steffy and Rick discuss Stephanie's discovery of their relationship and worry about how Ridge will react when he finds out.
• Taylor discovers that Steffy is in a secret relationship with Rick and is shocked and upset by the news, feeling that Rick is using her daughter.
</summary>

<summary>
• The scene is set at the Forrester estate, where Nicole and Zende's Valentine's Day wedding is taking place. Guests are arriving, and the atmosphere is filled with excitement and love.
• Nicole is getting ready with her mother, Vivienne, and sister, Maya, while Zende is preparing with his parents, Kristen and Tony. The couple is surrounded by friends and family, including Eric, Quinn, Ridge, Steffy, and Liam.
• Sally Spectra and her grandmother, Shirley, have crashed the wedding with a cake, hoping to get exposure for their fashion brand. They pose as caterers to gain access to the estate.
• As the ceremony begins, Carter welcomes everyone and expresses gratitude for being able to share in the love between Nicole and Zende. The couple exchanges vows, and the atmosphere is filled with joy and happiness.
• The wedding is a beautiful celebration of love, with many heartfelt moments between the couple and their loved ones. The scene ends with the "Wedding March" playing, and Nicole walking down the aisle to meet Zende.</summary>

<summary>
• Wyatt is considering returning to Spencer Publications after his father, Bill, asked him to come back, but only if Sally is involved and Bill resurrects Spectra Fashions, which he previously destroyed. Wyatt wants to make things right with his father and prove that he has changed.
• Katie is dealing with the aftermath of her annulment from Thorne, who left her due to his unresolved feelings for his late wife, Darla, and his concerns that Katie still has feelings for Bill. Bill visits Katie and Will, offering his support and expressing his concern for their well-being.
• Donna talks to Justin about Bill's visit to Katie's house and how he seemed genuinely concerned about Katie and Will's well-being. Justin is happy to see Bill happy and wants to support him in his efforts to reunite with his family.
• Wyatt and Sally discuss his potential return to Spencer Publications, and Sally expresses her happiness and success at Forrester. Wyatt believes that Sally can accomplish more on her own and that her future can be incredible, but Sally emphasizes that her future is bright as long as Wyatt is by her side.</summary>

<summary>
• Liam and Hope discuss Steffy's intentions during the waiting period for their divorce, with Liam expressing concern that Steffy is trying to make things difficult for them, while Hope feels insecure about Steffy's presence in Liam's life.
• Meanwhile, Brooke and Ridge meet Bill and Katie for dinner at Bikini, where they engage in awkward conversation and discuss their children, including Hope and Liam's situation, with Bill expressing his disapproval of Hope and Liam's relationship.
• Liam and Hope share a romantic moment, with Liam suggesting they start their lives together immediately, but Hope is hesitant, and they ultimately decide to wait, with Hope expressing her desire to be married to Liam and start their life together.</summary>

<summary>
* Nick asks Storm to act as his attorney, citing concerns about Taylor's ability to care for their son Jack due to her drinking problem and emotional instability.
* Brooke reveals that she is Jack's biological mother, and Nick wants to request an emergency custody hearing to ensure the child's safety and well-being.
* Taylor is unaware of Nick's plans and is trying to bond with Jack, but Rick expresses concerns about her ability to care for the child on her own.
* Phoebe discusses her mother's situation with Ridge, who advises her to give Brooke space and not worry about her.
* Felicia visits Ridge and discusses their parents' upcoming anniversary, suggesting they plan a family gathering to bring them back together.
* Storm agrees to help Nick with the custody case, but advises him to be prepared for a tough battle in court.
* Taylor receives the summons for the emergency custody hearing and is devastated, blaming Brooke for Nick's actions.
* Nick and Brooke discuss the case, with Nick assuring Brooke that he is doing what's best for Jack, and Brooke expressing her own pain at losing custody of her children in the past.
* Taylor calls Nick, accusing him of trying to take Jack away from her and blaming Brooke for his actions, but Nick insists that he only wants what's best for their son.
* Rick comforts Taylor, promising to support her and help her keep custody of Jack, and Taylor breaks down in tears, determined to fight for her child.
</summary>

<summary>
* Liam visits Steffy and their daughter Kelly, and they discuss how Liam is struggling with being apart from Hope and their daughter Beth, who is living with Hope. Steffy reassures Liam that Hope will eventually forgive her and that their love for each other and their children is pure and true.
* Thomas reveals to Douglas that he is getting married to Zoe soon, which upsets Douglas. Hope tries to calm Douglas down, but Thomas is insistent that the wedding will happen soon. Zoe is also nervous about the situation, but Thomas reassures her that everything will be fine.
* Steffy confronts Thomas about his motives for marrying Zoe, accusing him of trying to manipulate Hope into marrying him instead. Thomas denies this, but Steffy is unconvinced. She also discovers two wedding gowns, one for Zoe and one for Hope, which further fuels her suspicions.
* Hope confides in Liam about Thomas's plans to marry Zoe quickly, and Liam tells her that he believes Thomas is trying to manipulate her into marrying him. Hope is torn between her love for Douglas and her concerns about Thomas's motives, and Liam warns her not to let Thomas get away with his manipulation.</summary>

<summary>
• Ridge and Caroline are preparing for the birth of their baby, with Thomas present to support them, while Rick is upset with Ridge over his manipulative behavior and the fact that he moved into the Forrester house after Rick left.
• Eric tries to mediate between Rick and Ridge, but Rick is angry and feels that Ridge is controlling and manipulative, and that Eric always sides with him, while Eric is excited about the new baby and wants to focus on the positive aspects of the situation.</summary>

<summary>
* Steffy and Liam are preparing to leave for their wedding in Sydney, Australia, and are excited to have their friends and family joining them on the trip.
* Thomas stops by Sally's office to say goodbye before heading to the airport, and Sally reveals that Thomas invited her to be his date at the wedding, but she declined.
* However, after Thomas leaves, Sally's grandmother Shirley convinces her to book a flight to Sydney and crash the wedding, seeing it as an opportunity for publicity and to get back at the Forresters.
* Meanwhile, on the plane, the group is settling in for the long flight, with Bill and Katie chatting and Brooke and Ridge preparing for their own upcoming wedding.
* Eric and Quinn are also on the plane, and Eric is reflecting on how happy he is to have Quinn as his wife and to see his family so happy.
* As the plane takes off, Sally books a cheap flight to Sydney, determined to make an appearance at the wedding and cause a stir.
* The episode ends with a dramatic cliffhanger, as Brooke calls out to Ridge and a mysterious scene unfolds involving Nicole, Maya, and Quinn.</summary>

<summary>
*Katie is in the hospital with heart failure due to myocarditis, an inflammation of the heart muscle, and her family is worried about her condition.
*Donna confronts Brooke and Bill about their involvement in Katie's condition, suspecting that they are responsible for her heart failure.
*Brooke and Bill explain that Katie had an episode in the car on her way home from Brooke's place, where she had gone to confront them about their relationship.
*Donna is skeptical of their story and accuses them of hiding something, but they insist that they are telling the truth.
*Hope and Liam arrive at the hospital and are shocked to learn about Katie's condition.
*Taylor, Katie's therapist, arrives at the hospital and is suspicious of Brooke and Bill's involvement in Katie's condition.
*Brooke and Bill reveal that they had a car accident the night before, but they didn't tell Katie about it because they didn't want her to worry.
*Donna discovers that Brooke hid Bill's car in her garage to avoid a police investigation, and she accuses Brooke of protecting Bill.
*The doctor explains that Katie's condition is critical, but they are doing everything they can to save her.
*Taylor threatens to find out the truth about what happened to Katie and accuses Brooke and Bill of hiding something.
</summary>

<summary>
• Steffy and Liam are preparing for the arrival of their baby, with Liam seeking advice from his father Bill on how to be a good parent, while Steffy runs into Hope at the office and they have a heart-to-heart conversation about their complicated past and Hope's feelings about Steffy's marriage to Liam.
• Meanwhile, Brooke is struggling with her emotions and reaches out to Eric for support, and later tries to call Bill but ends up not leaving a message, while Hope is trying to come to terms with her feelings and move forward, and the scene ends with a dramatic and intense sequence of events, including a car accident and the sound of Hinder's "Born to be Wild" playing in the background.</summary>

<summary>
* Beth Logan is struggling with memory problems and early signs of dementia, which is causing her to feel like she's losing her sense of self and her connection to her family.
* Despite her family's efforts to convince her to stay, Beth initially decides to return to Paris, feeling that she doesn't want to be a burden to her loved ones and that she wants to be remembered for who she was, not who she's becoming.
* Beth's daughters, Brooke, Katie, and Donna, are determined to help their mother and convince her to stay, sharing their own experiences with struggle and dependence to try to reach her.
* Meanwhile, Marcus, Donna's newly discovered son, is navigating his new relationships with his family members, including Steffy, who is warning him about her father's disapproval of Donna and Marcus's presence in the family.
* Steffy and Marcus bond over their shared experiences as outsiders in the Forrester family, and Steffy advises Marcus to stay true to himself and not let her father's opinions get to him.
* Rick, Marcus's cousin, is initially surprised by Marcus's revelation but ultimately welcomes him as family, and the two share a laugh about the complexities of the Forrester family tree.
* Beth's family continues to try to convince her to stay, with Stephen, her husband, emphasizing the importance of their family being together and supporting each other through difficult times.
* Ultimately, Beth is moved by her family's words and decides to stay, acknowledging that she's scared but wanting to be with her loved ones and make the most of the time they have together.</summary>

<summary>
* Brooke and Nick are stuck on a boat in the fog, and they try to make the best of the situation by cooking and eating fish, and getting to know each other better.
* Meanwhile, Rick tries to warn Sally about Deacon's intentions and how he's using Macy to get back at the Forrester family, but Sally defends Deacon and Macy's relationship.
* Deacon proposes to Macy, and she's touched but hesitant, feeling that things are moving too fast, but Deacon reassures her that he's sure about their relationship.
* Brooke and Nick continue to bond over their shared experiences and values, and they discuss their future plans and aspirations, including Nick's desire to have children.
* Macy and Deacon's conversation about their relationship and future plans continues, with Macy expressing her concerns and Deacon reassuring her that he's committed to their relationship.
* Brooke and Nick's conversation turns to their attraction to each other, with Nick revealing that he's heard rumors about Brooke's intentions to return to Forrester, and Brooke denying them, but they both acknowledge a mutual attraction.</summary>

<summary>
* Brooke informs Donna that she has chosen her to replace her as the spokeswoman for Brooke's Bedroom, a successful clothing line.
* Donna is hesitant at first, but Brooke assures her that she will teach her everything she needs to know and that she trusts her more than anyone else.
* Nick encourages Donna to accept the job, but she is concerned about what Ridge will think, as he is also involved in the line.
* Meanwhile, Bridget reveals to Dante that she is not pregnant, despite their efforts to conceive, and expresses relief, which upsets Dante.
* Felicia, Dante's ex, reveals that she is happy that Bridget is not pregnant and warns Dante that he will never be happy with Bridget.
* Ridge is disappointed to learn that Brooke has resigned as spokesmodel for the bedroom line and that Donna will be replacing her.
* Donna tries to convince Ridge to continue designing for the line, but he is hesitant, feeling that it won't be the same without Brooke.
* Donna shares her admiration for Ridge and Brooke's relationship, calling it the "gold standard" of love, and expresses her desire to find something similar.
* Ridge is touched by Donna's words and agrees to continue designing for the line, with Donna as the new spokesmodel.
* Donna is overjoyed and promises to be there for Ridge in any way she can, both personally and professionally.
</summary>

<summary>
• The Forrester family is dealing with internal conflicts, particularly between Ridge and Thorne, who have been at odds over the direction of the company. Eric and Stephanie are forced to make a difficult decision, and in a surprising twist, they decide that Ridge is the one who will be leaving the company, not Thorne.
• Meanwhile, Felicia is dealing with her own issues, including a confrontation with Nick over his accusations about her alleged drug problem, and a conversation with Thomas about his love life, in which she offers him advice about being nice to his father and treating him like a friend.</summary>

<summary>
* Donna Logan's wedding to Thorne Forrester is halted when Thorne realizes that Donna doesn't truly love him, but rather is seeking revenge against his mother, Stephanie. This revelation comes after Katie, Donna's sister, informs Thorne about Donna's true intentions.
* The failed wedding leads to a confrontation between Donna and Stephanie, with Donna vowing to one day exact her revenge on Stephanie, who had been opposed to the marriage from the start. Meanwhile, Thorne is left to process his emotions and come to terms with the fact that he was nearly deceived into marrying a woman who didn't truly love him.</summary>

<summary>
• Thorne kicks Donna out of the Forrester house after Eric catches her in bed with Owen, her assistant, and orders her not to return.
• Eric is recovering from his coma and is being cared for by his family, who are trying to keep him calm and stress-free.
• Donna tries to explain the situation to Brooke, claiming that she and Owen were just comforting each other and that she loves Eric, but Brooke is skeptical.
• Stephanie tells Donna to stay away from Eric and the Forrester house, claiming that Eric wants to be with her and that Donna has given up her right to see him by sleeping with another man.
• Donna refuses to back down and vows to fight for her marriage and her right to see Eric, accusing Stephanie of manipulating him.
• Eric's family is trying to protect him from Donna and Pam, who is still on the loose after attempting to kill him.
• Taylor is struggling to care for her baby, Jack, and is refusing to accept help from anyone, including Nick, due to her fear of losing custody again.</summary>

<summary>
• Deacon returns to see Hope, bringing flowers and apologizing for his past mistakes, including leaving her on her wedding day. Hope is glad to see him and they discuss her failed marriage to Liam, which was complicated by Liam's feelings for Steffy and a series of misunderstandings.
• Meanwhile, Bill and Katie discuss Liam's future, with Bill pushing him to move on from Hope and become a more ruthless businessman. Liam seems uncertain, but Bill is determined to mold him into a true Spencer.
• Rick and Thomas discuss the latest Hope for the Future campaign, which features Thomas and Hope together. Caroline is uncomfortable with the idea, but Rick assures her it's just business. Thomas receives a call and leaves, and Rick kisses Caroline, revealing his feelings for her.
• The episode ends with Hope reflecting on her past with Liam, and Deacon promising to stick around and support her. Bill is seen talking to an unknown person, who has arrived at his office, and the scene ends with a cliffhanger.</summary>

<summary>
• Thorne is met with unexpected support and love from his parents, Eric and Stephanie, who acknowledge his accomplishments and express pride in him, despite their past disagreements. Eric offers Thorne a chance to return to Forrester Creations, but Thorne is hesitant due to Ridge's dominance in the company.
• Meanwhile, Thomas is secretly meeting with Amber, despite his father's restraining order against her. Amber is working at a new job, and Thomas is sneaking around to see her. Stephanie discovers their secret and confronts Amber, who tries to deny any wrongdoing.
• Ridge prepares to leave for a business trip, and Brooke expresses her concerns about being left alone with the children. Stephanie is dealing with the aftermath of Thorne's decision and the situation with Thomas and Amber, while Eric is trying to balance his family life with his business responsibilities.</summary>

<summary>
* Bill tells Liam to call off the engagement with Hope, as he believes she doesn't truly care about Liam and only lets him be a part of her life when it suits her.
* Hope is unaware of Liam's current emotional state and believes he's out having a wild bachelor party, but in reality, he's at a sophisticated party thrown by his father, Bill.
* Steffy is still interested in Liam and believes Hope doesn't appreciate him, while Katie advises Steffy to stay away from Liam and married men in general.
* Bill asks Steffy to drive Liam home and try to end the engagement, as he believes Liam deserves better than Hope.
* Liam is upset with Hope for not being able to move up the wedding date and feels like she's choosing her work over him.
* Steffy tries to comfort Liam and offers to practice a conversation with him, pretending to be Hope, to help him express his feelings.
* Liam confides in Steffy about his frustrations with Hope and feels like their relationship has become one-sided.
* Steffy offers to spend the night with Liam, but he declines, and she asks if she can give him a friendly kiss, which he hesitates to respond to.
* Meanwhile, Hope is preparing a romantic evening for Liam, unaware of his current emotional state and the conversation he had with Steffy.
* Bill is determined to end the engagement and believes that Steffy is the right person to help him achieve this goal.
</summary>

<summary>
• Nick and Bridget discuss telling Brooke about Bridget's pregnancy with Nick's child, which could potentially cost Nick his marriage to Brooke.
• Taylor and Hector discuss Shane, a man who knows that Phoebe was involved in Darla's death, and how he might use this information against them.
• Brooke and Jackie talk about Brooke and Nick's decision not to have children, with Jackie expressing her disappointment and concern that Nick may not be happy with this decision.
• Phoebe and Shane have a conversation in which Shane tries to reassure Phoebe that he won't reveal her secret, and Phoebe is torn between trusting him and being wary of his intentions.
• Stephanie and Taylor discuss how to handle Shane, with Stephanie suggesting that they need to find a way to neutralize him, and Taylor warning against doing anything to make him angry.
• Nick prepares to tell Brooke about Bridget's pregnancy, trying to reassure her that their love for each other will overcome any challenges that come their way.</summary>

<summary>
• The scene opens with Brooke, Hope, and Donna shocked to learn that Flo is Katie's kidney donor, with Brooke expressing her outrage and Hope questioning how this could have happened without their knowledge.
• Meanwhile, Wyatt and Sally are taking care of Beth at home, with Douglas's help, and discussing the challenges of caring for a baby, as well as Wyatt's past relationship with Flo.
• At the hospital, Flo explains to Katie that she donated her kidney because she wanted to help and make amends for her past mistakes, and Katie is grateful for her sacrifice.
• However, Brooke and Hope make it clear that they are not forgiving Flo for her role in keeping Beth's true identity a secret and causing them so much pain.
• Katie, while acknowledging the hurt Flo caused, is grateful for her sacrifice and believes that Flo's father, Storm, would be proud of her for saving her life.
• Wyatt and Sally discuss their engagement and future plans, with Sally expressing her concerns about Wyatt's past feelings for Flo and Wyatt reassuring her that he is committed to their relationship.
• Brooke confronts Shauna about her role in keeping Flo's donation a secret and warns her to stay away from the Logan family, as well as her husband.
• The episode ends with the Logan family and their loved ones reflecting on the emotional events that have transpired and the challenges that still lie ahead.
• Despite the tension and conflict, the episode also highlights the themes of love, forgiveness, and the complexities of human relationships.</summary>

<summary>
• Quinn Forrester is dealing with the aftermath of finding her son Wyatt in bed with Katie Logan, which led to a physical altercation and her throwing out her back. Mateo, a massage therapist, helps Quinn relax and work through her emotions, but Eric Forrester is furious with Quinn's behavior and feels she is out of control.
• Meanwhile, Sheila Carter, a former adversary of the Forrester family, has started working as a waitress at a restaurant near Forrester Creations. She runs into Pam, Stephanie Forrester's sister, and tries to make amends and gain her trust, while also expressing her concerns about Quinn's behavior and its impact on Eric.
• Sheila is secretly plotting to drive a wedge between Eric and Quinn, and is using Mateo as a source of information about the couple's dynamics. She is determined to win Eric back and is waiting for the perfect moment to make her move.</summary>

<summary>
*Ridge reveals to Thorne that he called in a favor from a judge to help Katie gain custody of her son Will, which was a move to get revenge on Bill.
*Bill discovers that Katie is now allowing him to see Will as much as he wants and believes Brooke is responsible for the change, thanking her and trying to get close to her.
*Pam and Charlie get engaged in the kitchen while making lemon bars, and Pam wants to get married at the Forrester estate in front of her sister Stephanie's portrait.
*Ridge tells Thorne that Bill has been hitting on Brooke, and Thorne is shocked and angry, but Ridge says Brooke promised to stay away from Bill.
*Brooke tries to convince Ridge that Bill is not a threat to their relationship, but Ridge is still angry and wants to protect his wife and family from Bill's manipulation.
*Pam and Charlie's wedding plans are discussed, with Quinn suggesting a medieval-themed wedding, but Pam wants a traditional wedding at the Forrester estate, which Eric agrees to host.</summary>

<summary>
• Ridge Forrester, presumed dead, returns and reunites with his loved ones, including his wife Brooke and his family.
• Brooke had been grieving Ridge's death and was being comforted by Nick, who had promised to take care of her.
• Massimo Marone is overjoyed to see Ridge alive and thanks those who helped him, including Brooke and Nick.
• Stephanie Forrester, Ridge's mother, is also reunited with her son and apologizes for being hard on Brooke in the past.
• Deacon Sharpe asks Amber Moore to leave his home, citing that her presence is confusing for their son Eric.
• Bridget Forrester supports Deacon's decision, which leads to a heated argument between Amber and Bridget.
• Amber seeks comfort from her boss Oscar, who tries to reassure her that she is a good mother and that she will bounce back from this setback.
• Sally Spectra is upset about a newspaper article, but it is not clear what the article is about.
• Deacon and Bridget have a heart-to-heart conversation, and Deacon expresses regret for his past mistakes and appreciation for Bridget's care and concern.
• The episode ends with Ridge and Brooke looking forward to starting their life together again, and Massimo and Stephanie seeming to put their past differences aside.</summary>

<summary>
• Rick is unhappy with a design created by Caroline and Ridge, and he tells Maya that he might include it in the line if they remove a bow-like feature. Maya teases Rick about being a designer and asks where Caroline and Ridge are, but Rick doesn't know.
• Hope confronts Deacon about his relationship with Quinn, telling him that he needs to choose between her and Quinn. Deacon is torn, and Quinn tries to convince him that she's genuinely interested in him, not just using him to get to Hope.
• Maya suggests to Rick that Caroline and Ridge's partnership might be more than just professional, and Rick becomes defensive. Maya reveals that she caught Caroline and Ridge in an intimate embrace, which makes Rick uncomfortable.
• Hope talks to Wyatt about her concerns regarding Deacon and Quinn's relationship, and Wyatt tries to reassure her that they should focus on their own lives and not worry about their parents.
• Deacon confronts Quinn about her intentions, and she tries to convince him that she's genuinely interested in him. Deacon is still unsure, but Quinn tries to seduce him, and he agrees to stay with her.
• Maya continues to try to drive a wedge between Rick and Caroline, telling Rick that Caroline doesn't appreciate him and that she would be a better partner for him. Caroline and Ridge share a bittersweet goodbye, hinting that their partnership might be coming to an end.</summary>

<summary>
* Bill Spencer is in the hospital after being pushed over a balcony by Ridge Forrester, but he has decided not to press charges and instead wants to change his life and practice forgiveness.
* Brooke Logan visits Bill in the hospital and believes that he is genuinely trying to change, but Eric Forrester is skeptical and thinks that Bill's motivation is to get back to Brooke.
* Meanwhile, Pam Douglas is arguing with Quinn Fuller about having her wedding at Eric's house, and Quinn's attitude towards Pam is causing tension, especially after Quinn destroyed Stephanie's portrait.
* Ridge visits Bill in the hospital and they have a heated argument, with Bill claiming that he is a better man than Ridge and that Ridge will eventually let Brooke down again.
* The argument between Pam and Quinn escalates, with Pam trying to take Stephanie's portrait to get it repaired, and Eric intervenes to try to calm the situation, but Pam decides that she can't get married at the house due to the conflict.
* Bill is discharged from the hospital and leaves with Justin, but not before Ridge threatens him to stay away from Brooke, which Bill dismisses as Ridge being on edge because he thinks Bill is after his wife.</summary>

<summary>
* Thomas Forrester is preparing to unveil his new men's line at a fashion show, but he's worried that it will be overshadowed by Hope's successful premiere of her "Hope for the Future" line.
* Thomas confides in Brooke that he has a plan to get the audience's attention, but he won't reveal what it is, and Brooke agrees to go along with it.
* Meanwhile, Oliver and Hope are discussing their past and their feelings for each other, and Oliver tells Hope that he's not giving up on their relationship and that their future together will be great.
* As the fashion show continues, Thomas's models take to the runway, but the audience's reaction is lukewarm, and Whip, Thomas's publicist, is worried that Thomas's line won't get the attention it deserves.
* Just as it seems like Thomas's line is going to be a disappointment, he and Brooke make a dramatic entrance, and the audience erupts in cheers and applause, suggesting that Thomas's plan may have worked after all.
</summary>

<summary>
• Ridge is searching for his son Thomas, who has gone missing, and is concerned about his well-being after a recent escalation in his behavior.
• Hope reveals to Brooke that she killed Thomas by pushing him into a vat of hydrofluoric acid, but Brooke tries to convince her to keep the secret and not tell Ridge or the police.
• Brooke reminds Hope that the acid and the vat have been disposed of, and there is no evidence to link her to the crime, but Hope is wracked with guilt and wants to confess.
• Ridge talks to Steffy about Thomas's recent behavior, including his attempt to trade custody of his son Douglas for sex with Hope, and his subsequent chase of Hope around the Forrester building.
• Steffy is shocked and disgusted by Thomas's actions, and Ridge is worried about his son's well-being and the impact of his behavior on those around him.
• Hope is torn between her desire to confess and her fear of the consequences, including losing her marriage, her baby, and her freedom.
• Just as Hope is about to confess to Brooke, Thomas suddenly appears, revealing that he is alive and not dead as Hope had believed.
• Hope is shocked and relieved to see Thomas alive, and the scene ends with her sobbing and apologizing to him.</summary>

<summary>
• Stephanie is struggling with her health, and Brooke is by her side, trying to comfort her. Stephanie gives Brooke a ring, symbolizing a newfound appreciation and acceptance of their complicated past. As Stephanie's condition worsens, Brooke reads her a story and eventually sings to her, bringing a sense of peace and closure.
• Katie is struggling with postpartum depression, feeling overwhelmed and unsure if she's fit to be a mother. Taylor, who has experienced loss herself, offers words of encouragement and helps Katie to see that she's not alone and that her feelings are valid. Katie eventually begins to bond with her baby, Will.
• The episode features various characters reflecting on their relationships with Stephanie, including Eric, who acknowledges his complex feelings towards her. Other characters, such as Pam, Rick, and Steffy, also share their appreciation and gratitude towards Stephanie, highlighting her impact on their lives.</summary>

<summary>
* Stephanie Forrester is in the hospital after being shot, and she accuses Donna Logan of being the shooter, which Donna denies.
* Eric Forrester is torn between his loyalty to his wife Stephanie and his relationship with Donna, and he asks Donna to tell him the truth about what happened.
* Brooke Logan and Ridge Forrester discuss the shooting and the possibility that someone from Brooke's family was involved, but Brooke is adamant that none of her family members would do such a thing.
* Pam Douglas, Stephanie's sister, arrives at the Forrester mansion and offers to take care of Eric while Stephanie is in the hospital, but Eric makes it clear that he is committed to Donna.
* Donna confronts Stephanie in the hospital and denies shooting her, suggesting that Stephanie may have staged the shooting to win Eric's sympathy.
* The police investigation into the shooting is ongoing, and it is unclear who actually pulled the trigger, but tensions between the Forrester and Logan families continue to rise.</summary>

<summary>
• Phoebe returns home after her tour and reunites with her mother, Taylor, who is glad to have her back. Phoebe expresses her hurt and anger towards Taylor for getting involved with Rick, her first love.
• Brooke wants to invite Rick to her rehearsal dinner and wedding to Ridge, but Ridge is hesitant due to Rick's disapproval of their relationship.
• Phoebe talks to Ridge and agrees to sing at his rehearsal dinner. She also apologizes for not appreciating his efforts to protect her in the past.
• Brooke tries to convince Rick to attend her wedding and support her relationship with Ridge, but Rick is adamant that he will not support their marriage.
• Taylor congratulates Ridge on his upcoming wedding and asks him to promise to spend time with their children and bring stability to the family, despite his marriage to Brooke.
• Ridge agrees to Taylor's request and promises to come over and spend time with the kids. Taylor also asks Ridge to promise to move on from their past relationship.
• Brooke has a heart-to-heart talk with Rick and expresses her desire for him to be there for her on her special day. Rick eventually agrees to attend the wedding and support his mother.
• Rick's change of heart comes after Brooke shares her feelings and asks him to be there for her, and he ultimately decides to put aside his disapproval and support his mother's happiness.</summary>

<summary>
• Brooke suggests to Ridge that they should all come together as one big, happy family, including Taylor, Nick, and their son Jack, who is Brooke's biological son due to a mix-up in the fertility lab.
• Ridge is hesitant and feels that Brooke's plan will only lead to more problems, especially given her history with Nick and the fact that Jack is her biological son.
• Taylor is also opposed to the idea of Brooke being involved in Jack's life, fearing that Brooke will try to take Jack away from her and Nick.
• Nick, on the other hand, thinks that it's okay for Brooke to see Jack once in a while, but Taylor disagrees, feeling that it's too much of a temptation for Brooke.
• Brooke and Ridge have a heart-to-heart conversation, and Brooke explains that she wants to be a part of Jack's life, but Ridge is still opposed to the idea, feeling that it will only lead to more problems.
• Brooke ultimately decides that she needs to let go of Jack and not be involved in his life, in order to protect her relationship with Ridge and to respect Taylor's wishes, which breaks her heart.</summary>

<summary>
• Thorne confesses to Brooke that he has been wanting to kiss her for a long time, and Brooke is flattered but also cautious due to her complicated history with Thorne and his brother Ridge.
• Ridge discusses his plans to guide R.J. in his design career, but R.J. mentions that Thorne is also trying to make a name for himself as a designer, which doesn't sit well with Ridge.
• Ivy and Quinn discuss engagement rings, and Simon, the new intern, is asked for his opinion, but he surprises them by proposing to Ivy, who declines.
• Nicole returns from Paris and catches up with Maya, discussing their lives and relationships, including the possibility of Thorne and Brooke rekindling their romance.
• Thorne tries to persuade Brooke to consider a future with him instead of Ridge, citing Ridge's past infidelities and lack of commitment.
• Quinn and Ridge discuss the engagement ring he's planning to give to Brooke, and Quinn teases him about his past feelings for her.
• Thorne confronts Brooke about her past with Ridge, including his kiss with Quinn, and tries to convince her that she deserves better than Ridge.
• Maya and Nicole speculate about the possibility of Thorne and Brooke getting back together, which could lead to tension between Thorne and Ridge.
